lrxAzDVgX7c.title: From Emo To 'Modern Glam' - And I Love It | TRANSFORMED
lrxAzDVgX7c.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

CAT, 22, from Ohio describes herself as 'emo scene', which is made up from “dark makeup, poofy hair and fishnet clothing”. It takes her around four hours to get ready every day and she wears “all the colours in the rainbow” but hates the colour brown because “it looks like mud”. She makes her own accessories and uses this subculture to express her creativity. Cat is now undergoing an 'Instagram glam' makeover - but will she like it? How will her fiance and friends react to the new her?

9e6FdZOVEZ8.title: Will My Date See Past My Disability? | DATING DIFFERENT
9e6FdZOVEZ8.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

MICHELLE is a model and mum of one from New York. At the age of 19 she had a bad car accident which resulted in her becoming an above-the-elbow amputee on her right side. Michelle found it hard to adjust to her amputation as she was right arm dominant but she doesn't let her disability get in her way and embraces her difference. Michelle told Truly: “Dating with an amputation can be intimidating” and she hopes her date can look past it. She will be going on a blind date with Prince, a fashion enthusiast. Will he be able to look past her disability and will they hit it off?

Videographer: Marcus Cooper & Kevin Huang
Producers: Alicia Bailey & Tom Buckman
Editor: Helen McKee

q8iRNBrx87k.title: My Friends Want To Date My 'Hot' Mom | MY EXTRAORDINARY FAMILY
q8iRNBrx87k.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

TATIANA, 18, and Pandora, 47, from Dorking, UK, are a mother and daughter duo who shot to online fame after being mistaken for sisters. Tatiana was the mastermind behind the two of them starting to make TikToks together; one video of them both singing to a popular pop song received over 700,000 views and people couldn't seem to believe they were mother and daughter. Tatiana and Pandora received comments such as: "Which one is the mum?", "omg you're twins" and "this is why I need a kid young". However, not all of the comments were positive... Pandora told Truly: "The comments that I don't like are when people say: 'You're just trying to be young when you're not'. I'm not trying to be young, I'm just being myself and doing something with my daughter." Tatiana has also had some online trolls commenting on her body type and has even been accused of photoshopping herself due to her slim figure. Despite the negative comments the pair have received, they love making TikToks together and have no plans to be stopping anytime soon.  

Follow Tatiana here:
https://www.instagram.com/tatianafs1/

Videographer: Marcus Hessenberg
Producers: Milly Martin, Yasmin Walker
Editor: Cecilia Brunelli

5AjVTd3T5w8.title: Jessica Alves Reveals Her New Voice | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
5AjVTd3T5w8.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

TRANSGENDER woman Jessica Alves witnesses the results of her vocal feminisation surgery for the very first time on camera. Three years ago, 39-year-old Jessica began her physical transformation into a female body. "I didn't know that I was transgender, but I knew that I was different. Other people knew that I was different, my family, friends, and the boys at school who used to physically bully me only because I was different", Jessica reflected. "I wasn't like these people, then I realised that I was transgender." She has spent over £800,000 modifying every inch of her body over the past 18 years, including a breast augmentation and gender reassignment surgery. However, her latest medical procedure is one of the most integral parts of her personal journey. In this episode, Jessica goes to Kamol Hospital in Bangkok, Thailand for facial and vocal feminisation surgery. She explained to Truly why this step was so important: "I'm just so excited about this surgery, today is the very last day of my life - that I'm actually going to sound and look like this." She will be supported by her friend Darcie, who is also a trans woman and underwent the same procedures at the clinic previously. "You are judged on your face and your voice. The results are life-changing", Darcie explained. Jessica will see the dramatic changes in her voice levels for the very first time and reveal how she feels about it to Darcie. 

Videographer: Florian Witulski
Producers: Nathalie Bonney, Yasmin Walker
Editor: Tani McDowell

3HLnSD0drEE.title: He's 'Feminine' & I'm 'Masculine' - And We're In Love | LOVE DON'T JUDGE
3HLnSD0drEE.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

TO JAMES and Maren, they aren't any different from other heterosexual couples. But other people have often mistaken them for just friends because of the way they look. 22-year-old James, who previously identified as gay, is a feminine-presenting man, whilst Maren, 20, is a masculine-presenting woman. Growing up, James came out as gay to his friends and family because it was "easier". Maren, who describes herself as bisexual, had only dated women before she met James over TikTok and the two hit it off instantly. When they shared their relationship online, James and Maren faced a lot of judgement as people struggled to comprehend their relationship. But the couple couldn't care less about what others say.

eFtn-Lm__Qk.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

VERONICA Merrit, aka ‘madmama’ as she calls herself on TikTok, loves having children. She's well-known online for having a large family of 12. She says: “I’ve been pregnant most of my life." Being a mom is a full time job; she has colour coded her children and it sometimes takes her three hours to prepare dinner. Her current youngest is a newborn and her eldest, who’s 21, gave birth this month. In fact she and her daughter were pregnant at the same time. Veronica is still going - she’s in the process of adopting her 13th child, Michael, and today she’s introducing Michael to her sister who hasn’t always been keen on Veronica adding more children to the family...

yV7YkUpiFQo.title: I Can't Walk Or Talk - But I Found True Love | LOVE DON'T JUDGE
yV7YkUpiFQo.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

THIS INTERABLED COUPLE claims their relationship is genuine despite what the haters say. John Larkins, aka Larko, is a rapper who was born with cerebral palsy, leaving him unable to walk or speak. He uses a device operated by eye gaze to communicate and write lyrics. His music has jetted him to multiple countries to perform, but he is taking a break after recently becoming engaged to his fiancé, Takhmina. The couple met while holidaying in Dubai and quickly fell in love. After getting engaged earlier this year, they are now planning for their big day. People have "warned" Larko that Takhmina is just after his money, but the couple isn't bothered by others' speculation.

Producers: Dan Coles, Emilia Jiang & Natalia Giorgi

NxToKqzZmVM.title: I Do OnlyFans - With My Mom | MY EXTRAORDINARY FAMILY
NxToKqzZmVM.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

JEMA, 39, and Ellie, 20, from Kent, UK are a mother and daughter duo who have recently hit the headlines after their joint OnlyFans platform has outraged members of the public and made them targets for online trolls. Jema, who has been a glamour model all of her adult working life, became one of the first ever women to make a profile on the subscription site and, not long after, her daughter Ellie decided to follow in her mum's footsteps. Jema told Truly: "I was quite surprised when Ellie joined my industry, because she grew up wanting to work in an office and had no interest in this line of work." After some initial success, Ellie then developed big ideas and became the driving force of them making a joint account to upload content together. Despite their love for what they do and their ever growing success, they have received some vicious online hate and have had to defend their platform at every turn. They said: "Some of the worst stuff that I have heard or seen is; how we can be 'trashy' and 'how can you do that with your mum?' It might be out of the norm but we're not a typical mother and daughter." The comments continued to get worse and Jema even received a death threat; but despite everything they see and hear from the haters, the pair love what they do and won't stop for anybody. They added: "If people think this is an inappropriate job for mother and daughter to do, they've got the right to their opinion... But do we care about your opinion?... NO!"

Videographer: Jon Constantino
Producers: Adam Fleet, Kim Nguyen
Editor: Jonny Poole

oa6fJp3mV-4.title: We Both Got Pregnant - And We Don't Know Who By | MY EXTRAORDINARY FAMILY
oa6fJp3mV-4.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

Alysia, Tyler,  Sean and Taya started off as two couples but now they describe themselves as a quad. They met as swingers but couldn’t get enough of each other. “When we started talking we met that very next week, we just wanted to see more and more of each other,” 27-year-old Taya told Truly. They never stopped talking and eventually Alysia, 33, and Sean, 45, admitted they had feelings for each other. Soon after Taya and Tyler, 35, said that they felt the same. The four now all live together in a beautiful spacious house in Oregon with horses in the back garden. The men swap bedrooms every night and share two children (an eight and seven-year-old) Alysia and Tyler had before, as they describe it, their 'closed quad' met. In 2021 Alysia and Taya each gave birth to a baby but they haven't found out which man is the biological father to either baby - and they don’t want to know. Alysia said: “Sure I’ve wondered about it but I see Sean as a wonderful daddy to the babies and I see Tyler as a wonderful daddy too.”  

Follow their story here:
https://www.instagram.com/polyfamory/ 
https://www.tiktok.com/@polyfamory

Videographer: Scot Ballard
Producers: Bethan Kapur, Natalia Giorgi
Editor: Helen McKee

bC3nGo9IVOo.title: Trolls Claim My Wife Looks Like 'A Child' | LOVE DON'T JUDGE
bC3nGo9IVOo.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

Couple Lyndsey and Jonathan have received a lot of judgement for their difference in size and Lyndsey’s extremely young-looking features. People often assume that Lyndsey, age 22, is a child and the pair are in an underage relationship. However, Lyndsey’s tiny size is due to a rare form of cancer she was diagnosed with at the age of five. The cancer caused her hormones to stop working and meant she didn’t grow taller than 4ft10. The couple have to deal with stares and whispers in public (Jonathan is a whole foot taller at 5ft10) but they receive most of their negative comments from trolls online. Jonathan says “it can be hard but because we love one another we just push it to one side”. 

Follow their story here:
https://www.instagram.com/lyndsey_ashton22/
https://www.tiktok.com/@lyndsey_ashton22

Videographer: Nick Stubbs
Producers: Alicia Bailey, Natalia Giorgi
Editor: Emma Mitchell

DxRm1zxIMoY.title: I’m Not Your Average Grandma | MY EXTRAORDINARY FAMILY
DxRm1zxIMoY.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

TAMMY, 46, from Florida, is not your average grandmother. She lives a very extravagant life and has hit back at online trolls who hate her appearance and way of living. Tammy is a multiple business owner, from real estate, to OnlyFans and loves the expensive things in life. Tammy describes her look as something in between Barbie and Dolly Parton, which is only enhanced by her six breast surgeries. Tammy gets a lot of attention, positive and negative about her looks and says that you either 'love me or hate me - there's no middle ground'. She told Truly: "When I get the negative reactions, I feel that it's not me, it's them and they are narrow minded. I know this is my choice and how is my look affecting you? Going this large was the best investment I did in regards to weeding through fake people." Tammy's strength was something that came to her after the loss of her youngest son Matthew, which affected and changed the family dynamic forever. Tammy said: "The loss of Matthew changed my views for a few things. Always be kind to people and to really not care what anybody thinks." With that, Tammy expanded her modelling businesses, including OnlyFans, and got the surgeries she always wanted. With the support of her Stepson, Daniel, and her ex husband, now best friend Jim, Tammy hopes to keep growing her online presence and wants to be as successful as possible. Tammy added: "For the people who feel the need to tear other people down, I might not agree with everybody's beliefs but I surely don't tear other people apart for no reason."

Videographer: Carlos De Varona
Producers: Becky Robinson, Adam Fleet
Editor: Ethan Edwards

tAMswloW_mI.title: I'm 23, He's 62 - But I'm Not After His Money | LOVE DON'T JUDGE
tAMswloW_mI.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

IT was love at first swipe for 23-year-old model Willow and 62-year-old real estate developer David who met on Tinder. The couple hit it off on their first date and have now been together for a few months. David was Willow's first and only Tinder date. She says it was an instant connection and they fell in love in one hour. David told Truly: “It was an unbelievable connection. I just fell like immediately." The couple became official after their date and have been inseparable ever since. They have been enjoying each other's time by travelling around the world together, dining at restaurants and attending events. David and Willow haven't shied away from sharing their relationship online but that has come with judgement. As well as being judged for their age difference, they have also received comments suggesting Willow is only after David's money. When Willow first met David she didn’t want to be influenced by anything. She said: “I didn't want to be influenced by anything outside. I just wanted to like know him as a person first…Let me see if I like you like you too, before I let any outside factors, like make me feel any type of way." The couple choose to ignore the comments because they know what they have is real and continue to share their life and the fun things they get up to.

She says it was an instant connection and they fell in love in one hour. David told Truly: “It was an unbelievable connection. I just fell like immediately." The couple became official after their date and have been inseparable ever since. They have been enjoying each other's time by travelling around the world together, dining at restaurants and attending events. David and Willow haven't shied away from sharing their relationship online but that has come with judgement. As well as being judged for their age difference, they have also received comments suggesting Willow is only after David's money. When Willow first met David she didn’t want to be influenced by anything. She said: “I didn't want to be influenced by anything outside. I just wanted to like know him as a person first…Let me see if I like you like you too, before I let any outside factors, like make me feel any type of way." The couple choose to ignore the comments because they know what they have is real and continue to share their life and the fun things they get up to.

0AympCHQLwg.title: I'm 30, He's 60 - Now We're Having A Baby | LOVE DON'T JUDGE
0AympCHQLwg.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

Mindy, 30, and her husband Larry, 60, have established a huge following online documenting their age-gap relationship. In 2020, the couple began exploring their options to have a baby, made more difficult as Larry had already had a vasectomy. It hasn't been an easy journey for the couple to conceive and after rounds of failed IVF, the couple had almost given up hope until Mindy finally fell pregnant in December 2021. When they shared the news on social media, the announcement led to a tidal wave of backlash, with people accusing the couple of "being selfish" for having a baby because of Larry's age. Despite the criticism, Mindy and Larry say they are excited to welcome their first child and have plans to try for a second one. Mindy said: "We have plans to go back and try again for a second baby, and just raise our family."

Follow Mindy and Larry:

0uJeYC_VVfU.title: My Rare Condition Meant I Couldn't Eat Food | BORN DIFFERENT
0uJeYC_VVfU.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

FEARLESSY breaking down barriers, Anja Christoffersen was born with VACTERL Association - an acronym that stands for vertebral, anal, cardiac, tracheal, oesophageal, renal and limb. It’s a collection of birth defects that have caused Anja to have over 35 surgeries and 150 hospital admissions in her life, including emergency surgery on her food and air pipes, bowel and bladder when she was only an infant. Her condition meant she had to learn a totally different way of life, and that's exactly what she did. But she didn't stop there, ever inspiring and continuously trying to help those who need her, the model, author, CEO and public speaker set up Champion Health Agency, a talent agency helping people turn their lived experiences into careers - and with that growing a base of individuals that all help to inspire the current and next generation. Anja said: "Realising that I wasn't alone is one of my huge motivations for sharing my story." She added: "I'm incredibly passionate because I think it gives a great opportunity to show to a mainstream audience representation of minority groups. I think that it has such great value, especially to young people and children to see themselves represented in media, that they can do it too, and that there are people like them that are successful."

Follow Anja here: https://www.instagram.com/anjachristoffersen/
Follow Champion Health Agency here: https://www.instagram.com/championhealthagency/
Check out their site here: https://www.championhealthagency.com

Videographer: Rob Norton
Producers: Dan Coles, Natalia Giorgi
Editor: David Bamford

f4bm6s7BgdQ.title: She's Not A 'Gold Digger' - We're Getting Married | LOVE DON'T JUDGE
f4bm6s7BgdQ.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

JUDGED for their weight difference, Sienna and George have been together for four years after Sienna saw George on TV and slid into his DMs. The happy couple shared their relationship online and started to receive comments saying that Sienna was only with him for money and that there’s no way Sienna is in love with him. After receiving the hate they have online, they didn’t let it break them up or affect them in any way - and have now shared their wedding day. The now married couple refuse to let the hate dictate their love life and instead pay attention to their supporters knowing they are as happy as they have ever been - no matter their size difference. George said: “When we started talking on Instagram, I think what really connected us was we were so alike. We were both creative, we were both determined in wanting to succeed in life and we just got on with it. We kind of clicked straight away, and we got on and that chemistry was already there before we even met in real life.” Sienna added: “So now that we're married I really feel like we're proving the trolls wrong. Everyone said that I'm a gold digger and in it for money, well actually I'm in it for life dammit!”

Follow George: https://www.instagram.com/georgekeywood/
Follow Sienna: https://www.instagram.com/siennakeera/
Check out their TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@siennakeera

Videographer: Matthew Hurley
Producers: Dan Coles, Kim Nguyen
Editor: Pete Ansell

3IF9EYESBLw.title: He Gave Me A Lap Dance - And We Fell In Love | LOVE DON'T JUDGE
3IF9EYESBLw.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

LOVE at first glance, says Shannon Lawson, who was smitten with Dreamboys creative director Jordan Darrell even before he slid towards her on his knees on stage and gave her a lap dance. The pair met when Shannon saw Jordan perform and was quick to keep in touch before the end of the night. Fast forward a couple of years and the pair are engaged and have had their adorable son Ruben. But as much as it was a new love, it was also a new career for Shannon, who decided to get into exotic dancing herself after seeing Jordan strut his stuff while they were dating. Now, the couple are both working in the industry but are still being targeted by people online saying that they can't be good parents because of the work they do. Regardless of the judgment they receive, they say they have built their own family bubble and are thriving in their careers, refusing to let trolls stamp on the life they have built together. Shannon said: "The very first time I met Jordan was at one of his strip shows, my first thought and impression was that this guy is a bit of me." Jordan said: "I was a professional dancer and got into stripping by auditioning with my friend. We absolutely, in my words, killed that audition and then the rest is history, now I take my clothes off every day of the week." Shannon added "We just had a conversation one day and I said I really want to try it. I have tried other things, but stripping was like the one thing that I hadn't tried and I really did want to give it a go."

Socials: 
Shannon's instagram: https://www.instagram.com/shann.lawson/?hl=en
Jordan's Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/jordandarrell/?hl=en
Dreamboys instagram: https://www.instagram.com/dreamboys/?hl=en
Dreamboys web: https://www.dreamboys.co.uk

Fxym43RNgn4.title: Everyone Thinks I'm Kate Moss | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
Fxym43RNgn4.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

DENISE Ohana from Liverpool, England shares an uncanny resemblance with one of the most iconic models in the history of fashion - Kate Moss. Getting stopped in the street and mistaken for the real Kate is a regular occurrence for Denise due to her being the spitting image of Mossy. Thanks to her likeness to Kate, Denise has carved out a successful career as a lookalike and has become something of a local celebrity in her hometown. When she reached her teens, strangers started to notice she was Kate’s doppelganger. Denise told truly: “When I got to about 16 I used to get scream at in the street, ‘Oh my God there’s Kate Moss’ and I’d have people shouting, ‘can I be your agent!’” As she grew up Denise began to look more and more like Kate, she told Truly: “As I got older I feel like I’m morphing more and more into Kate but it’s not like it’s done purposefully. I almost feel like I look more like her when I’ve got no makeup on, then you can just really see the features, it's not made up with anything.” Truly visited Kate at home to find out what it’s like to be a Kate Moss lookalike and have a peek at some of the Moss-inspired garments she has in her wardrobe.

Follow Denise Here:
https://www.instagram.com/iamnotkatemoss/
https://www.tiktok.com/@iamnotkatemoss
https://www.instagram.com/doddywood/

Videographer: Tim Brunsden
Producers: Tom Jones, Yasmin Walker
Editor: Pete Ansell

KzaarU40sjA.title: I Went Viral Because Of My Stammer | BORN DIFFERENT
KzaarU40sjA.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A TIKTOK star’s confidence has grown thanks to her speaking challenge videos. Jessie Davies, 29, from South Wales could not speak until she was about four years old due to a delay in her speech development and this progressed into a stammer. In November last year, Jessie started sharing videos about her stammer on TikTok including ‘speaking challenge’ videos where she would put herself in situations that she found difficult such as drive-thrus and talking on the phone. She has now garnered over three million followers on TikTok and is raising awareness about speech impediments. Jessie told Truly: “I just feel I now want to be the woman I needed as a little girl.” Today, Jessie is doing a speaking challenge in her local town carrying a sign that reads ‘I have a stammer, let's talk.’ Jessie said: “Even though it is only a few words on a piece of card, I feel it is really powerful and hopefully we can spread awareness today.”

Follow Jessie here:
https://www.tiktok.com/@mimidarlingbeauty?lang=en 
https://www.instagram.com/mimidarlingbeauty/ 

Producer/ Director : Mattia Reiniger
Producers: Emika Berry, Yasmin Walker

jwc3a32G6bM.title: My Beard Started Growing At 16 | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
jwc3a32G6bM.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

GENNEVIEVE from Canada was 16 when she first started growing hair on her face. Confused by what was happening, she was eventually diagnosed with PCOS - a condition that affects a woman’s hormone levels. One of the symptoms includes hirsutism, which creates excessive hair growth on the face, chest and back. She told Truly: “When it first started growing I felt confused and really embarrassed. I had really low confidence and self-esteem. I just wanted to hide.” Desperate to hide her facial hair, Gennevieve would constantly wax and shave. She said: “I avoided going out as much as humanly possible.” Eventually, she realised she didn’t want to hide anymore and started sharing photos of her beard on Instagram. “The reaction online was great. People were really supportive,” Gennevieve explained. Today, we see Gennevieve going to get her beard trimmed for the first time - something that five years ago, she never could have imagined doing. “I feel really proud of my beard. The advice that I want to give other women who have facial hair is that you are not alone. It is possible to learn to love it. I love my beard!”

Follow Gennevieve here:
https://www.instagram.com/beardedladyg/

Videographer: Dennis Porter
Producers: Kathryn Lewsey, Natalia Giorgi
Editor: Josh Brown

wxNPFLy8ug8.title: I Was Living A Double Life - But I'm Done Hiding | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
wxNPFLy8ug8.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

 SOMETIMES to be comfortable in your own skin you have to make sacrifices. For Cloe Rain, 24, one of those sacrifices was moving away from her family and hometown in Minnesota to live as a trans woman in Texas. In her old life in Minnesota Cloe felt constantly stared at: "People would yell at me," she says. However now, Cloe has found a community that is more accepting. Although even in Austin leaving the house dressed in a really girly way is nerve wracking for her. Today Cloe’s going to face that fear as she meets one of her best friends and trans mentor Eve Marie who wants to help her find the perfect outfit to go out in. Cloe says: "I usually go out in sweatpants and casual clothes so today is a pretty big moment for me."

Follow Cloe Here:
https://www.instagram.com/cloexrain/ 
https://www.tiktok.com/@cloexrain2?lang=en  

Videographer: Davin Fitch
Producers: Bethan Kapur, Yasmin Walker

iZDerktjc6Y.title: Today I'm Transforming To Girly Glam | TRANSFORMED
iZDerktjc6Y.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

LEYA, 22 from Idaho, describes her style as dark, punk-gore and menhera - and refers to herself as a ‘bloody monster elf’. She is obsessed with anything medical/body related - blood, eyeballs, hearts and has various accessories that mimic them. The 22-year-old says she felt inspired by elves after playing fantasy games when she was younger to escape reality because ‘reality is so boring’. She said: "It’s a huge part of my identity and if I don’t dress like this I don’t feel like myself." Today, Leya is being transformed into a pastel babe. How will she react to seeing herself in a completely different aesthetic? Will her friends prefer her new look?

Follow Leya here: 
https://www.instagram.com/blo0d_doll/
https://www.tiktok.com/@blood_d0ll

LJIA5Tsakng.title: We Have 12 Children - And Yes They’re All Ours | MY EXTRAORDINARY FAMILY
LJIA5Tsakng.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A FAMILY that dances together stays together - at least that’s the case for the Storm family who went viral on TikTok after posting videos of themselves dancing. The family of 14, who are based in California, have always enjoyed dancing and performing together. But it wasn’t until 2021 that mum, Iris, began sharing her family’s talents on social media. Within months the family had gone viral. Parents Storm and Iris have shared their love of dancing with their kids from a young age. Storm told Truly: “We started teaching our kids [to dance] right out the womb to be honest! If I’m holding the baby, the baby’s going to dance!” The couple have received some negative comments about their large family. “It bothers me when people say I can’t give proper attention to all of my kids, because I’m intentional with every one of them”, Iris said. Despite some of these comments, the Storm family are well loved on social media, with many fans commenting on their incredibly close bond. “Dance keeps us together, it keeps us moving at one beat”, says Storm. 

Follow the family on social media:
TikTok: @mrsstorm11
IG: @the.storm.family @mrs.storm @cordellstorm   

Producers: Milly Martin, Nathalie Bonney, Natalia Giorgi
Editor: Reuben Yarwood

ftWg4IVUaQQ.title: Born Without A Uterus - But I’m Becoming A Mom | BORN DIFFERENT
ftWg4IVUaQQ.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

JACLYN Misch from Michigan was diagnosed with Mayer-Rokitansky-Küster-Hauser syndrome (MRKH) when she was 16 years old. Jaclyn’s diagnosis revealed that she was born with her ovaries intact but without a uterus and a fully formed vagina, meaning that she would be unable to get pregnant. MRKH has affected Jaclyn throughout her life, growing up as a young woman she felt different and was confronted with questions about her own womanhood. Despite her condition Jaclyn has always been determined to be a mother with her loving husband Jon. Together the couple have struggled through failed IVF and surrogacy attempts but are now excited to welcome their child thanks to Jon’s cousin Kelly acting as their surrogate. Jaclyn said: “Something that I wish people knew about MRKH syndrome is that it doesn’t make me or anyone diagnosed less of a woman, just because you can’t give birth to a baby, there are many other ways to mother."

Videographer: Marcus Cooper
Producers: Rafaela Kuznec, Georgia Embling, Kim Nguyen, Alicia Bailey
Editor: David Bamford

8saU6LaMwQU.title: I Have 1 Wife - And 7 Girlfriends | LOVE DON'T JUDGE
8saU6LaMwQU.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

MONOGAMY isn’t for everyone - and it certainly isn’t for Brazilian based model Arthur O Urso, who is in a poly relationship with his loving wife Luana, and their seven other girlfriends. Arthur admits he was always worried about finding love due to his 'plump size' but after meeting and marrying Luana he was inspired to drop nearly five stone and gained his confidence back. At this point, the married couple started introducing more partners to their now poly lifestyle. Since sharing their story with the world they have received negative judgment from every angle with people saying their lifestyle is “disgusting” - but remain confident in their decision and choose to ignore the trolls and focus on their own happiness. Arthur said: “To remember their names for a while was difficult but not now. These days I fight for a cause and many admire the courage I have to confront society and live the life I always dreamt of. The main consequence of this lifestyle is being excluded from society, because it’s hard to make friends, especially when you have this status and image. But we never cared for friendship. We always lived for each other, always. Since the beginning of the relationship we always thought that we don’t need other people to be happy. That’s why we never listened to other people, we chose to live the life we always wanted.”

T0_uZKvprRU.title: I Left Home A Farm Boy - And Returned A Glamour Model | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
T0_uZKvprRU.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A HOLLYWOOD burlesque dancer has swapped Sunset Blvd for dirt roads in Iowa as she finally confronts the father who told her ‘she’d never be loved’ as a transgender woman. Cassandra Cass, 41, was a 14-year-old farm boy with no qualifications, when she left Iowa to pursue her dream of becoming a woman. News of her departure and decision to transition shocked the rural community she came from and caused a rift between Cassandra and her father Bill, 75, for many years. Although the father and daughter are now on speaking terms this is the first time Cassandra will see her father since the pandemic. The two have agreed to have a no-holds barred conversation about the past in the hope that it will bring them closer together - but there’s every chance it could further draw apart the father and daughter. 

Follow Cassandra Here:

Ab2pQAIb0qY.title: My Face Is Paralysed So I Can't Smile | BORN DIFFERENT
Ab2pQAIb0qY.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A 24-YEAR-OLD who had to undergo four surgeries just to be able to smile is now embracing his differences. Austin Halls, from New Jersey, was born with Moebius syndrome, a rare condition that causes facial paralysis. Due to the condition, Austin cannot move his eyes left and right, and when he was younger, could not smile, completely close his mouth or pronounce the letters P and B. Between the ages of 10 to 18, Austin underwent four surgeries to alter his facial muscles to be able to smile. After his surgeries, Austin had to re-learn social cues to react with his face, and, according to him, it’s something he has “to consciously do now”. Despite his struggles due to his condition, Austin has become a musician, life coach, and advocate for the Moebius community - as well as representing the gay and disabled communities across social media. Austin told Truly: “Music has always been my therapy. When I have trouble expressing myself through facial expression, music is always such a powerful tool for that.”

Follow Austin here:
https://www.instagram.com/hallsy5555/
https://www.tiktok.com/@austinhalls 
https://open.spotify.com/artist/1wuAlAwVjnnmeNJ1NiaMSF?si=ejnv38MsQ_-EI_cWvuOV5A&utm_source=copy-link

Videographer: Kevin Huang 
Producers: Tom Midlane, Becky Robinson
Editor: Alex Saunders

md4BMfHcRWQ.title: I Woke Up And My Body Was On Fire | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
md4BMfHcRWQ.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

NANCY, 40, from California, was 19 years old when her ex set her on fire, changing her life forever. After splitting up, Nancy had agreed to meet her ex one last time. Nancy explained to Shake My Beauty that when they said goodbye to each other, her ex said: “I’ll see you on the other side.” Confused by what he meant, she went to bed. “Next thing I knew, I was on fire,” she explained. Suffering 35% burns to her face, neck, arms, upper chest and hands, Nancy was left wondering, “Why me?”. After spending nine months indoors, she finally felt able to leave the house, but still covered up in a bucket hat and trench coat. Eventually embracing her body, Nancy now refuses to hide her scars - she’s proud of them. She said: “He wants me to live a miserable life, but the best revenge is to live my best life."

Follow Nancy Here:
https://www.instagram.com/fancyshnancy/

Videographer: Brandon Hickman
Producers: Kathryn Lewsey, Yasmin Walker
Editor: David Bamford

EsvdGJ3hLA4.title: Tonight We're Hosting Our First Swingers' Party | LOVE DON'T JUDGE
EsvdGJ3hLA4.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

BEFORE she met her boyfriend Shawn through a vegan dating app, mum-of-two Lana struggled with body confidence. But with Shawn, a newfound love for her body grew, from his encouragement to embrace her sexual side. He has a more unconventional view of how relationships could work, and after they got together, he brought up the idea of an open relationship. Shawn told Truly: “At the beginning, our relationship was pretty normal I'd say, but I knew I wanted something different.” Lana admitted that she was initially concerned about this: "When Shawn said that he wanted to open the relationship I was a little bit offended. I felt like, why is that, like am I not enough by myself?” After they opened their relationship up, the couple's dynamic grew more and more unconventional. Now, they get a childminder on the weekends, so they go to nudist beaches, swinging parties and making adult content.

Videographer: Juan Antonio 
Photographer: Ros Gonzalez
Producers: Kate Moore, Kim Nguyen
Editor: Garry Sykes

fT55NqC-kW4.title: Real-Life Monster Gets An Insta Model Makeover | TRANSFORMED
fT55NqC-kW4.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A REAL-LIFE monster who has dressed alternatively since she was a teenager has undergone a shocking transformation. Jules, 29, from North Carolina, has dressed in an extreme vampire-esque aesthetic for the last five years. Complete with a painted white face, fangs, and heavy dark eye makeup - Jules appears anything but ‘normal’. With the help of a makeup artist, Jules is undergoing a transformation from her monster look to a more basic, girly style. Jules told Truly: “I’ve forgotten what it’s like to look normal - I have this fear that I’m going to super love it!”

Follow Jules here:

Nok5U2xS2_k.title: I'm Missouri's First Trans Homecoming Queen | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
Nok5U2xS2_k.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

LANA is an aesothician, drag performer and Missouri’s first transgender homecoming queen. She remembers telling her high school friend when she came out as trans, but it took a bit longer to tell her mum. She sent her mum a text in the lead up to a cheerleading banquet saying she was wearing a dress, and her mum then didn’t attend the banquet. However when Lana won homecoming it was then clear to her family that she was happy as a trans woman in a school full of people who accepted her. Lana could also handle herself against the haters who protested outside her school. These days, although they sometimes have their concerns, Lana’s family are very supportive of her and today Lana has some important news for her family, she wants to tell them about a surgery she’s having soon...

Follow Lana Here: 
https://www.instagram.com/landonpatterson/ 
https://www.tiktok.com/@thelandonpatterson

nCFQMEm2D8w.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

28-YEAR-OLD Bri, from LA, is going on her first ever blind date. Bri is a social media personality and YouTuber who has gained almost 60,000 subscribers by posting honest videos about her lifestyle - she works as a Sugar Baby who regularly gets taken on lavish trips to exotic locations courtesy of her Sugar Daddies. When it comes to dating, Bri has recently turned to dating apps but hasn't had much luck and finds that most guys aren't thrilled to discover they're competing with rich Sugar Daddies. Meeting her for a blind date today is Miguel, 23, who works in film and TV as a freelance production assistant. Will the two hit it off?

ILfUZY91RCY.title: I’m A Disabled Model - How Will My Date React? | DATING DIFFERENT
ILfUZY91RCY.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

UP until the age of 12, Rafi was an energetic boy who made it his life’s mission to terrorise his three older sisters. But when he was 12, Rafi suffered a terrible stroke and haemorrhage that forced him to relearn how to walk and talk. His body was forced into locked-in syndrome. Rafi's family would initially communicate with him just by blinking eyes at one another. But over time, Rafi has re-learnt how to walk and talk - though the stroke, which was caused by an Arteriovenous malformation (AVM), has left him with long term speech issues and also some memory loss. With an incredibly positive attitude, Rafi hasn't let anything stop him and he started modelling as a teenager and also took up competitive racerunning - where competitors use a frame to race. He has no problem attracting women on Tinder but getting beyond a first date has proved more difficult. On his profile he describes himself as a 'para athlete' and uses the emoji of a walking frame to indicate he has a form of disability... How will things go with his blind date today? 

Follow Rafi here:
https://www.instagram.com/rafi_solaiman/

Videographer: Thomas White & James Little
Producers: Nathalie Bonney & Becky Robinson
Editor: Sonia Estal

4jgfvnOqFSY.title: My Supersized Nails Cost $300 A Month | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
4jgfvnOqFSY.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A WOMAN has been growing her 14" super-long nails for nearly 16 years and has been designing them with colourful buttons. Janene Reed, 51, from New Jersey, was raised in a strict household that meant no makeup, no nail polish and no brightly dyed hair. When she became an adult and was able to finally express herself, she decided to start growing her nails - and hasn't stopped since. She's been growing her nails since early 2007 and they're currently 13-14". Janene’s favourite nail design is glued buttons to her nails that she has been doing since 2019. Janene gets a lot of stares and judgement but says she likes the negativity as it means she stands out. She's part of the Long Nail Goddesses - a group of women who are addicted to growing their nails, some up to 20" long. 

Follow Janene here:
https://www.instagram.com/janenereed/
https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100006605982716

b8jpytVfad0.title: My Kids Help Me With My Modelling Career | MY EXTRAORDINARY FAMILY
b8jpytVfad0.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

NEYLEEN, 33, from Miami, became a mum straight out of high school. Wanting to support her family, single mum Neyleen found that modelling on OnlyFans could make enough money to provide a good life for her children. The mum-of-two has been very open about her career with her two sons, Jordan and Brady. They understand that their mum works hard to give them a great life. The boys even help her with photoshoots during the school holidays. Despite this, many people are critical of her chosen career path, saying they feel sorry for Neyleen’s kids. But Neyleen says the reason she’s able to be so present in her children’s lives is because she works so hard at her career. She told Truly: “The minute I pick my kids up from school, I dedicate 100% of my time to them."

Videographer: Carlos de Varona
Producers: Milly Martin, Nathalie Bonney, Kim Nguyen
Editor: Tom Waddington

AXD2gAG5EZA.title: Ultimate Barbie Finds Her Inner Goth | TRANSFORMED
AXD2gAG5EZA.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A WOMAN who calls herself the ‘Brazilian Barbie’ is leaving her pink lifestyle behind to transform into a goth for the day. Bruna, from Parana, Brazil, lives in her dream home - fitted from top to bottom with a pink Barbie interior. Bruna has collected Barbie products since she was just 12 years old and calls the fashion doll her inspiration for everything. For the first time ever, Bruna is swapping out her pink outfits for a much darker, gothic look. Bruna told Truly: “Goth is totally different from my normal style, I try to avoid black unless it’s mixed with pink!” 

Follow Bruna here:

xLjjrY2mMNM.title: Our Poly Relationship Is Not 'Ungodly' | LOVE DON'T JUDGE
xLjjrY2mMNM.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

JOEL, 24 and Mickey, 22, met as teenagers in 2015. They fell in love and went from high school sweethearts to life partners. Mickey always knew she was bisexual and was open with Joel about this throughout their relationship. In September 2020, Joel met Jaida, 22 on an app. The group began their interactions platonically, but then their relationship grew to a romantic place. W6tKAroUbX0.title: I Survived An Acid Attack | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
W6tKAroUbX0.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

IN 2014, Reshma, then 17, was on her way to a school exam when someone poured acid on her face - changing her life forever. She said, "I thought to myself, how everything can just change in one second." The attack was a case of mistaken identity, as the assaulters - her brother-in-law and two accomplices - were aiming for her sister. Reshma was left with severe scarring on her face and neck, and lost an eye. The injuries affected her confidence and left her feeling very self-conscious. "I thought, my face is ruined," she explained. But over the years,  Reshma slowly began to embrace her scars and rebuild her life. She released a book about her journey and began modelling - even walking down the runway at New York Fashion Week. Reflecting on everything she’s been through, Reshma explained, "Beauty to me is not just the face. What’s more important is to have a beautiful heart and a beautiful mind."

Videographer: Tim Brunsden
Producers: Giacomo Brunelli, Becky Robinson
Editor: Josh Brown

qzG1L5El058.title: I Don’t Care That My Parents Are Poly | MY EXTRAORDINARY FAMILY
qzG1L5El058.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

EMILY, Trell and Allie are a polyamorous triad living with their children in Las Vegas. Emily and Trell met through mutual friends and have been together 12 years, and married for five. Emily is bisexual so the couple decided to open up their relationship to other women. However, these encounters didn't tend to move beyond the bedroom - that was until they met Allie. Now finding themselves in a throuple, the three also had to quickly adjust when Allie fell pregnant. Now a year old, baby Reign is being brought up with two mums. And Trell also has a 12-year-old daughter from a previous relationship who has had to get used to classmates asking questions about her family's extended setup. 

Follow the family here:
https://www.instagram.com/polyinfinity/

TVT3eqEZQxw.title: My Facial Tumours Won't Stop Growing | BORN DIFFERENT
TVT3eqEZQxw.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

NOT LETTING it take over his life, Sunaryo first started getting tumours when he was 17 and has battled with their severity for the last 50 years. The tumours, which started as just freckles on his face, have continued to form and grow and as result left Sunaryo receiving constant harsh words from anyone he met, even going as far as to say his condition is contagious and staying away from him. Even with this tough health condition, Sunaryo has not let it stop him living a full life, marrying when he was young and raising a family while owning and working on his own farm for as long as he can remember. The inspirational dad says he would rather not get surgery because of the complications it can cause because of his age and instead just wants to live the most full life he can with his family. Sunaryo, said: "I have been living with tumours since I was a teenager, they started as freckles on my face and became itchy. They eventually grew into this but it’s not painful."

Videographer: Jefri Tarigan
Producers: Dan Coles, Yasmin Walker
Editor: Hailey Wang

hllyXhhy1wc.title: I Need To Get My Bikini Body Back - ASAP! | RAHKI'S WORLD
hllyXhhy1wc.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

IN Miami, looking good and feeling great in summer is EVERYTHING. And Miami's Queen of Fitness Rahki Giovanni, Is on a mission to look and feel the best she ever has when she hits the beach this year. In the past few weeks, Rahki has been pushing herself in her training, but she needs a new challenge which will get her snatched for summer. Rahki told Truly: "It's really important for me to look good on the beach, not only where I live and because of who I am, but most importantly for myself'." Today, Rahki is meeting up with Crossfit trainer, Nate Gonzalez at Riptide Crossfit, to take on one of the biggest physical challenges of her life. Rahki told Truly: "I've been obsessed with Crossfit for five, maybe six, years and to me it's very extreme, I wanted to do the burpees non-stop, do the pull-ups non-stop, the ropes, the swimming, even the biking. For me that's a real conditioned athlete." But will Rahki survive her first ever Crossfit workout? Will this be the key to her getting snatched for summer?

Follow Riptide Crossfit:
https://www.instagram.com/riptidecrossfit/

Follow Nate Gonzalez:
https://www.instagram.com/coachnate8gonzalez/

Videographer: Carlos De Varona
Producers:Adam Fleet, Emilia Jiang, Yasmin Walker
Editor: Pete Ansell

Lht7umaDRWw.title: My Cleft Scars Are My Favourite Feature | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
Lht7umaDRWw.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A WOMAN born with a rare facial condition says she has learnt to love her scars. 25-year-old Isabella was born with a rare form of cleft, that meant her lip was attached to her eye at birth. She has had 23 reconstructive surgeries throughout her life, and bears the scars on her face because of them. Growing up was difficult for Isabella, as her peers would call her names and say she 'looked scary' on one half of her face. Though she struggled with her image in the past, today Isabella has gone above and beyond accepting who she is. 

Follow Isabella here: Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/isabella.welch/

cnZyNC-VduU.title: My Tourettes Went Viral - But People Think I'm Faking It | BORN DIFFERENT
cnZyNC-VduU.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

ZARA decided to post videos online to give insight into her reality of living with Tourette’s Syndrome after her tics got worse. The 16-year-old first experienced tics at the age of seven but aged 14, she said the situation ‘spiralled’. The teenager was also recently diagnosed with Functional Neurological Disorder (FND), which causes fainting and seizure episodes as well as paralysis. A video of her having a COVID test went viral and people accused her of faking it but Zara hopes to raise more awareness about her conditions. Zara is passionate about music - she sings, plays guitar and writes her own music - and these are things that give her a break from her conditions. She has been on a journey to accept her conditions and that she cannot control it. Zara said: “It doesn’t have to define who I am, I can be me separately and just have Tourette’s and I can post about it, but that’s not entirely who I am.” 

Follow Zara's journey here: 
https://www.tiktok.com/@zeezee25 
https://www.instagram.com/zara.bethx 
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCLvAmmzhy_4kl2oMje9Rk5w

localized.title: My Tourettes Went Viral - But People Think I'm Faking It | BORN DIFFERENT
localized.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

ZARA decided to post videos online to give insight into her reality of living with Tourette’s Syndrome after her tics got worse. The 16-year-old first experienced tics at the age of seven but aged 14, she said the situation ‘spiralled’. The teenager was also recently diagnosed with Functional Neurological Disorder (FND), which causes fainting and seizure episodes as well as paralysis. A video of her having a COVID test went viral and people accused her of faking it but Zara hopes to raise more awareness about her conditions. Zara is passionate about music - she sings, plays guitar and writes her own music - and these are things that give her a break from her conditions. She has been on a journey to accept her conditions and that she cannot control it. Zara said: “It doesn’t have to define who I am, I can be me separately and just have Tourette’s and I can post about it, but that’s not entirely who I am.” 

Follow Zara's journey here:

Videographer: Paul Chambers

FOR RAHKI, finding a dress that perfectly fits her thicc thighs can be a challenge. When she first started out on her fitness journey, Rahki's primary goal was losing weight. But when Rahki found her passion in weight lifting, she became obsessed with building muscles. uMM-qsuZAQ0.title: The 2ft 4in Teacher | BORN DIFFERENT
uMM-qsuZAQ0.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

STANDING at 28 inches tall, this teacher is shorter than most of his students. When Kirodhar was a baby, doctors told his family some of his bones had not developed and they did not think he would survive. But now, aged 42, Kirodhar has continuously defied doctors’ expectations and has made his family proud. While he does require the help of his parents for some daily tasks, Kirodhar has successfully become a shop owner and a teacher who is passionate about his students’ education. Kirodhar said: “Teaching children is an honour and a privilege.”

Videographer: Haziq Qadri
Producers: Emika Berry, Becky Robinson
Editor: Ian Phillips

ZY_OLWftHzM.title: Will My Blind Date Look Past My Skin Condition? | DATING DIFFERENT
ZY_OLWftHzM.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

22-YEAR-OLD Nathalie Richert, from Malmö, Sweden, is going on a date for the very first time in her life. Nathalie was born with ichthyosis with confetti, an extremely rare condition that causes red, scaly skin all over the body. In the past, the condition had left Nathalie feeling insecure about her body but she has been building up her confidence through modelling and raising awareness on social media. Nathalie said: "I have to be confident because it has made me strong. I don't wish to be someone else." Armed with the newfound self-love, Nathalie decides to give dating a go. She added: "I've been thinking about dating and of course, I want to have the experience of having a boyfriend." Today, she is meeting up with 20-year-old William, a choreographer and aspiring actor, who doesn't know anything about Nathalie prior to the date. Will he look past Nathalie's skin condition?

Follow Nathalie:
https://www.instagram.com/natharichert/

Follow William:
https://www.instagram.com/_williamca/
Email: wca.rising@gmail.com

Special thanks to Pablo Suzarte for providing additional photography.

j1Ck5FJQaP8.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

JEN from New York loves her ‘hot mom’ aesthetic, but she gets judged by other parents for dressing and acting inappropriately as a mom. Jen, 31,  lives with her fiance, Stephen, 43, and their three kids from previous relationships. The 31-year-old has also been called a ‘gold-digger’ for being with a man 12 years her senior; she loves plastic surgery and looking hot, and Stephen is happy to fund this lifestyle. Her kids love her look as it makes them more popular at school but has put a strain on relationships with other family members. The mom - and stepmom - has also dabbled in OnlyFans, but she pulled away when fans began demanding too much...

Videographer: Marcus Cooper

rGg3Pye2OxM.title: I Weighed 295lbs - Now I'm Learning To Love My Loose Skin | BRAND NEW ME
rGg3Pye2OxM.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

OSMARI, who has struggled with weight since childhood, has managed to lose over 100lbs in two years - and find a confidence she never had before. Osmari, from Miami, started gaining weight when she was a young child and at her heaviest was over 290lbs, facing Type 2 Diabetes. Osmari told Truly: “I’m extremely proud of myself - you can literally do anything you set your mind to.” Osmari’s initial weight gain stemmed from a deeply traumatic childhood experience, which resulted in her overeating: “I never realised that my childhood trauma was directly linked to my weight," she said.

dQdEO5ArM8Y.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

FLORIDA'S most beloved 'Queen of fitness' is back with a brand new season of 'Rahki's World' - and she is feeling sexier and stronger than ever. "Right now, I am more in love with my body than I would have ever imagined in my life," Rahki said. "I never, in my life, thought that I would feel that way, especially being the heaviest that I've ever been." Feeling rested and refreshed from the holiday season, Rahki is ready to return to the gym and continues working towards her fitness goal of getting lean. Today, Rahki is meeting up with boxing champion and trainer Jhon Matos, who challenged Rahki to a brutal boxing workout in Season 1. After a long, gym-free hiatus, Rahki is feeling quite nervous to see Jhon again. She said: "He might challenge me more because time's passed. But he doesn't know that I have not worked out." Will Rahki be able to push through her first gruesome workout of 2022?

JESS and Stephen from Sarasota, Florida have been together for 12 years. They believe that the reason they’ve lasted for so long is because they date and sleep with other women as a couple. Two years into the relationship they decided to explore polyamory and started dating and sleeping with other partners regularly. Currently the pair are in a loving trio with Jessa and also have many other girlfriends and casual partners. Recently the couple started posting content about their poly lifestyle on social media and gathered a huge following on their TikTok account. Sadly, they’ve received a lot of backlash and negativity from sharing their unique relationship dynamic with the online world. Trolls often make the judgement that the relationship weighed more in Stephen’s favour as Jess doesn’t get with any guys. Other commentators have remarked that there must be some sort of financial arrangement to their relationship. One post that caused a huge amount of controversy was when Jess posted saying Stephen was “too cute not to have kids.” Jess may be unable to have kids and is open to Stephen having a child with another woman. KVloCIzchew.title: My Girlfriend Loves Me - And My Hairy Face | BORN DIFFERENT
KVloCIzchew.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

JESUS was born with a rare genetic mutation called hypertrichosis, which has left him with excessive hair growth. Inherited from his great-grandmother, hypertrichosis means excessive hair growth that can occur anywhere on the body. Jesus didn’t always feel understood growing up, he found it difficult when he realised he didn’t look like other kids at school. He started working in circuses at 16 or 17 as a way to escape where he came from. It was at a circus show that he met Azucena, the love of his life. Jesus and Azucena now happily live together in Chihuahua and he says she has made him feel accepted for who he is.

Videographer: Cabe Tejeda
Producers: Bethan Kapur, Yasmin Walker
Editor: Tom Waddington

4IjIzG9oETw.title: We Tried For One More Baby - And 5 Arrived | MY EXTRAORDINARY FAMILY
4IjIzG9oETw.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

MEGAN Hulen and her husband Joshua had two sons; Jacob, seven and Matthew, two, when they decided to try for one more baby in the hope of having a little girl. They were told at an ultrasound seven weeks into the pregnancy that there were ‘five heartbeats instead of one’ and could not believe the news as they had a hard time getting pregnant. Megan said she panicked and ‘was thinking that I’m 5’1, where are all these babies gonna go and how is this gonna work?’ Despite all her infertility issues and health complications ‘all of the quints were born in four minutes’ and Megan ‘could not believe how fast they were born’. Talking about the judgement she received, the mum of seven says that people have commented on how irresponsible it is to have that many - but says most people have been super supportive and excited. 

Follow Megan here:
https://www.facebook.com/Hulen-Quintuplets-Hulen-Horde-100132268780490

Videographer: Josh Stokka
Producers: Nosheen Hussain, Natalia Giorgi
Editor: Giulia Bassanese

HfJi17fCIWY.title: Human Ken Doll Spends $70K Maintaining His Look | BLING LIFE
HfJi17fCIWY.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

JONATHAN DYLAN is Canada’s very own Human Ken Doll and has spent over CA$70,000 and rising to achieve his perfect look. Jonathan regularly spends around $3,500 a month on his beauty regime, and cosmetic procedures. He also adores designer handbags, and has spent over $36,000 on his collection. As an actor, TV personality, recording artist and social media influencer, he is no stranger to a bling and glamorous lifestyle. He wants to be the next big global star and looking good is the most important thing to him. Jonathan told Truly: “I originally came into the industry as a backup dancer and I met music executives and producers and that was when I was scouted to have my own song." Using that as a springboard into the limelight, Jonathan is never one to rest on his laurels. Quietly he has been working on some exciting business ventures, primarily his very own lip gloss range. Today, he is meeting with his best friend Tess to finally share the news he has been keeping tightly under wraps. 

Follow Jonathan here: 
https://www.instagram.com/jonathandylan/
https://www.tiktok.com/@jonnykendoll 
https://www.youtube.com/c/JonnyKenDollOfficial/featured 

Videographer: Kyle Sandilands
Producers: Joel Ross, Becky Robinson
Editor: Joshua Brown

FI377MVLZ0c.title: We're Trolled Because My Girlfriend Is Trans | LOVE DON'T JUDGE
FI377MVLZ0c.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

MATHILDA and Christian are a happy, young couple living in Gothenburg, Sweden. They’ve been together for eight years after meeting online and they instantly felt a special connection with each other after their very first dating app message. Mathilda is a transgender woman and, before meeting Christian, she had found the online dating world a bit of a minefield with men often disappearing or sending her nasty, abusive comments when she told them that she’s trans. However, Christian was supportive and accepting of Mathilda’s news that she was trans and their relationship grew and blossomed. The couple have experienced some comments online from trolls who say that Christian is ‘gay’; Christian explained how this makes no sense as Mathilda is a woman, saying to her: “It’s not true, I know that you’re a woman in every way possible.” These transphobic comments occur on a daily basis which they both find very draining. Truly met up with the couple at their home in Sweden to hear about the incredible news that they’re engaged and also hear how they’ve dealt with the awful online judgement they’ve had to face in their relationship.

Follow Mathilda and Christian here:
https://www.instagram.com/mathildahogbergs/
https://www.instagram.com/chrisblund/

Videographer & Photographer: Per Christian Lind
Producers: Tom Jones, Kim Nguyen
Editor: Reuben Yarwood

8iwQoahdUes.title: I'm Judged For Spending $100K On Latex | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
8iwQoahdUes.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A LATEX addict has spent a whopping €100K on her obsession. Miss Fetilicious, from Antwerp Province, Belgium, first got into latex seven years ago when she tried on latex leggings and, since then, started wearing that and rubber every day. She told Truly: “It's felt really great on my body, and I couldn't stop touching this shiny material. From that moment, I knew it was an addiction.” Over the years, she has amassed an impressive latex collection with over 80 hoods, 60 catsuits, 20 blouses, and many other outfits such as pants, leggings, skirts, and latex accessories that, according to her, feel like “a second skin”. Miss Fetilicious said: “I buy at least one new outfit every month. And, of course, I will never stop doing this because I really enjoy it.” Her family and friends are supportive of her wearing extreme outfits in latex as, like Miss Fetilicious herself, they see this as an expression of art rather than a fetish. And the occasional negative comments she gets online do not bother her: “I like to be different. I don’t want to be the same as everybody else because I think it’s boring.”

Videographer: Yann Verbeke
Producers: Rafaela Kuznec, Kim Nguyen
Editor: Guilia Bassanese

8AZ7VSps5ZM.title: My Facial Cancer Won't Stop My Acting Dream | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
8AZ7VSps5ZM.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

AN ASPIRING ACTRESS who had part of her jaw removed after being diagnosed with a rare type of cancer is hoping to inspire others with facial differences to follow their dreams.Crystal, now 23, was just 18 when doctors broke the news that what she had  thought was a small abscess on her gum was actually a tumour. As well as chemotherapy, she underwent surgery to remove a large portion of her right cheek, several teeth and her upper jaw. In the initial aftermath of the operation, she struggled with how much her appearance had changed, and would often hide her face away beneath her hair. But in time, she has learned to love herself. And now, after landing a place at a prestigious London drama school, she is one step closer to realising her dream of being an actress. Crystal told Truly: "I don't just want to play characters that are pitied or villainized. I want to prove that I'm more than my face."

Follow Crystal at https://www.instagram.com/faceinosteosarcomax/ and https://www.instagram.com/crystaltheactress/

Thank you to Luminosa for the photography used in this project. For information visit https://www.lumosia.com/ 

Videographer: Aran Lamond
Producers: Erin Cardiff
Editor: Garry Sykes

g-9zafdcPwk.title: Trolls Accuse Me Of Faking My Tourettes | BORN DIFFERENT
g-9zafdcPwk.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

BRYONY Munro, from Scotland, has always had tics but didn't realise how serious they were until 2021 when during the UK lockdown they got worse and she received an official tourettes diagnosis. Since her diagnosis, she has made it her mission to champion herself, her followers and everyone around her that a difficult diagnosis, no matter what it is, is only a part of your identity but not the full story. Since her diagnosis, along with her loving partner, she uses her social media to show what life is like with her condition, helping people understand the reality of tourette's syndrome and why it shouldn't stop you from living your best life. Bryony said: “I started having tics at the ages of 12 or 13. Tics in general are involuntary movements so we can't help what we do or what we say. They can be very oddly timed, sometimes people ask if a tic is what we're thinking and it's definitely not what we're thinking."  

To keep up with Bryony's journey, click here: https://www.instagram.com/brydoeslife/

Videographer: Kathleen Little
Producers: Dan Coles, Kim Nguyen
Editor: Helen McKee

7916y0LAP-U.title: I Left A Toxic Relationship And Lost 240lbs | BRAND NEW ME
7916y0LAP-U.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

Pureness Taylor’s weight loss journey was as much about a mental transformation as it was a physical one. The celebrity hair and makeup stylist, from Toronto, Canada, used food to cope with stress and anxiety following a toxic relationship. She told Truly: “Mentally I was destroyed, but I was smiling through it." Weighing almost 400lbs, Pureness knew that something needed to change. She started keto and omad fasting and quickly found that she had more energy to work out. Pureness has lost an incredible 240lbs over the last two years. She said: “I had to deal with what was going on on the inside before I could change on the outside.” 

Follow Pureness here: 
https://www.instagram.com/facesbypureness/
https://facesbypureness.com/ 

With thanks to:
Brent at Think Fitness Toronto - 
https://www.instagram.com/iambishop/
https://www.instagram.com/thinkfitnesstoronto/

Paul B, Photographer - https://www.instagram.com/paulished_snapshots_/

Videographer: Dennis Porter
Producers: Milly Martin, Kim Nguyen
Editor: Tom Waddington

aMdsh-92zxk.title: I Pick My Skin So Badly, I Almost Lost A Leg | BORN DIFFERENT
aMdsh-92zxk.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A LIFE of repetitive skin picking has led one woman on a journey to help others after almost losing her leg due to her condition. Since she was a child, Lauren McKeaney, of Chicago, has suffered with Dermatillomania – an obsessive-compulsive-related skin picking disorder. But in recent years, the 35-year-old has managed to get the condition under control and is using her experience to support others through her ‘Picking Me Foundation’.

You can find Lauren’s foundation at pickingme.org/ 

Lauren can also be found online at instagram.com/PickingMeFdn/  and #PickingMe 

Videographer: Lauren McKeaney
Producers: Joe Roberts & Yasmin Walker
Editor: Sonia Estal

JwZ5WzbmBLQ.title: I'm 24, My Wife's 61 - Now We Want A Baby | LOVE DON’T JUDGE
JwZ5WzbmBLQ.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

We previously filmed with TikTokers Cheryl, 61, and Quran, 24, from Rome, Georgia, back in 2021 when their huge age gap made headlines worldwide. Since then a lot has happened - in July 2021 Quran proposed, using a ring crowdfunded by his TikTok fans. The couple officially tied the knot in September of the same year in a romantic, riverside ceremony in Tennessee - which they livestreamed to an audience of over 20,000. The online judgment about their age gap is intense, but Quran and his new wife are determined not to let it overshadow their relationship. The pair are now eager to take the next step and begin a family, either by adopting or using a surrogate - and Cheryl’s grandchildren already call Quran “papaw”. In this episode we hear from the happy couple about married life, see them going out to browse baby clothes and hear from Cheryl’s adult daughter Ashlee about how she feels about the prospect of a baby brother. 

Follow Quran and Cheryl’s journey on TikTok:
Quran: https://www.tiktok.com/@kingqurannewpage
Cheryl: https://www.tiktok.com/@oliver6060

Videographer: Aakash Bakshi 
Producers: Tom Midlane, Becky Robinson
Editor: Jonny Poole

3JTqwD1wfsE.title: Human Elf Plans New 3D Printed Face | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
3JTqwD1wfsE.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

THE Real Life Human Elf is back with a bang! Luis Padron, from Buenos Aires in Argentina, has spent $85,000 on procedures to change his face so that he can look like a fantastical creature. Luis told Truly: "I would describe my look as a mixture of different fictional characters.” The most important parts of Luis' look are his eyes - he owns around 500 contact lenses, each costing $100. After a break from surgery, Luis is now ready for his biggest procedure yet. For a jaw-dropping $15,000, he will be getting a silicone mask implanted under his skin to change his jaw angles. Luis first visits his best friend Marcela Iglesias, to reveal his surgery plans, before a consultation with his surgeon for the jaw implants.

Follow Luis here: https://www.instagram.com/luispadron.elf/?hl=en

Follow Marcela Iglesias here: https://www.instagram.com/marcelaiglesiashollywood/

ZatRgUrLBJc.title: The Man With Elephant Sized Legs | BORN DIFFERENT
ZatRgUrLBJc.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

Rickshaw driver Chand, 42, from Shadnagar, India, has a condition called Filariasis, which has caused his legs to swell up to elephant-like proportions. Filariasis is an infectious tropical disease caused by thread-like parasitic worms, often transmitted through a mosquito bite. Chand’s swollen legs make it difficult for him to carry out basic domestic tasks and led his wife and children to leave him. However, he is still able to earn a living - with the help of his trusty rickshaw, ferrying loyal passengers around his home town each day. Chand dreams of one day owning his own rickshaw and getting surgery that will enable him to live a regular life.

Videographer: Akash Malattiri
Producers: Yasmin Walker, Irshada Ayoub & Tom Midlane, 
Editor: Garry Sykes

localized.title: The Man With Elephant Sized Legs | BORN DIFFERENT
localized.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

Rickshaw driver Chand, 42, from Shadnagar, India, has a condition called Filariasis, which has caused his legs to swell up to elephant-like proportions. Filariasis is an infectious tropical disease caused by thread-like parasitic worms, often transmitted through a mosquito bite. Chand’s swollen legs make it difficult for him to carry out basic domestic tasks and led his wife and children to leave him. However, he is still able to earn a living - with the help of his trusty rickshaw, ferrying loyal passengers around his home town each day. Chand dreams of one day owning his own rickshaw and getting surgery that will enable him to live a regular life.

Videographer: Akash Malattiri
Producers: Yasmin Walker, Irshada Ayoub & Tom Midlane, 
Editor: Garry Sykes

ZwXSC7KxEVo.title: I'm 71 - And A Champion Pole Dancer | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
ZwXSC7KxEVo.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

AT 71, and with 11 pole dancing world championship titles to her name, Greta is well and truly proving that age is just a number. 

In her younger years, she was a keen gymnast - but it was not until she was 59 years old that she took up pole dancing in a bid to stave off osteoporosis. Though she admits her first class was tough, she persevered and was soon mastering gravity-defying tricks.

At the age of 62, Greta, who lives in California, entered her first contest, competing against dancers decades younger than her - some as young as 18. Since then, she has been travelling the world, perfecting new routines, and participating in competitions. To date, she has won a grand total of 11 world championships. Not even a double hip replacement, a few years ago, stopped Greta, and she hopes her story will inspire others that they needn't be held back by their age.

Follow Greta at: 
http://www.facebook.com/gretapontarelli
http://www.instagram.com/aerialzen
http://www.youtube.com/gretapontarelli

Videographer: Brandon Hickman
Producers: Erin Cardiff, Natalia Giorgi
Editor: Helen McKee

lVYesfT5nEY.title: I Lost 120lbs - Now I'm Having My Loose Skin Removed | BRAND NEW ME
lVYesfT5nEY.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

MOM of two, Alex Athienitou, from London, England, lost over 100lbs in a year. The busy mom struggled with comfort eating and yo-yo dieting for many years, before deciding that she had to change her lifestyle. Alex chose to have weight loss surgery to help her with portion control. Despite the judgement she has received, Alex told Truly: “Some people say that surgery is the easy way out, but it’s categorically not. It saved my life!” Alex has maintained her weight loss through a combination of healthy eating and exercise. She now enjoys working out and living an active lifestyle. She said: “I hope that me speaking about how I chose to lose weight could help others on their weight loss journey. Everyone’s journey is totally different.”

Follow Alex here: 
https://www.instagram.com/vsg.andme.uk/

Videographer: Jonathan Constantinou
Producers: Milly Martin, Kim Nguyen
Editor: Ian Phillips

zHXHZhU45iQ.title: We Became Swingers Because My GF Wanted To Date Women | LOVE DON'T JUDGE
zHXHZhU45iQ.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

Bartender Kiley and her husband Brad, both 30, from Cleveland, Ohio, have been together for six years. Kiley was open at the start of their relationship that she was bisexual, but finding "unicorns" - single women willing to date couples - on dating apps proved difficult and so on the advice of a friend, they decided to try swingers clubs. The couple were reluctant at first but quickly fell in love with "the lifestyle" and began meeting up with other couples regularly. Indeed, Kiley was so won over that she began sharing her experiences on TikTok and is now one of the biggest lifestyle educators on “swingtok” with tens of thousands of followers. However Kiley’s social media success has come with a dark side and the pair have received a lot of judgment online, with trolls accusing them of having sexually-transmitted diseases or saying that they are setting a bad example for their children. But despite the backlash Kiley is determined to help normalise swinging and says it has helped radically change her life and her relationship for the better. 

Videographer: David Jones
Producers: Tom Midlane & Yasmin Walker
Editor: Joshua Brown

YCMEX74_0yE.title: I'm A Mother With Extreme Tattoos - So What? | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
YCMEX74_0yE.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

EXTREME tattoos have helped a 26-year-old mum to overcome her insecurities and gain a sense of self-love. Ravena, from Goiânia, Brazil, got her first tattoo when she was 18 years old but a year ago she decided to change her look and go for something more extreme than a regular haircut. She started tattooing her face, her body and even became a tattoo artist herself. Ravena credits tattoos for saving her life - they gave her newfound confidence and helped her express her true self. Ravena’s five-year-old daughter loves her tattoos, and as for her family, they were shocked about her changes at first but now support her decision to alter her look. The tattoo artist set up an Instagram page to share her tattoo journey with her followers and to inspire others not to be afraid to express themselves. Ravena said she is determined to carry on inking her body: “I am not sure how far I am going to go with it or what I am going to be modifying going forward but there is gonna be plenty!”

Follow Ravena here: 
https://www.instagram.com/raven_77/
https://www.instagram.com/ravena_ink/

Videographer:  Pedro Tavares Ladeira 
Producers: Rafaela Kuznec, Natalia Giorgi
Editor: Vanessa Nascimento

h6I4UIPgTh0.title: Cancer Took My Jaw | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
h6I4UIPgTh0.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

DIAGNOSED with a rare form of cancerous tumour at just nine years old, now 32-year-old Sonya has gone through major surgeries to remove most of her jaw. The condition, Ameloblastoma, usually originates on the jaw, as in Sonya's case. Her first symptoms were swelling on her face, uncontrollable tics and tooth pain. Throughout her life, she has gone through at least eight different surgical procedures to remove the tumour. Her biggest surgery to date was in 2018, when most of her jaw was completely removed. After surgery, she had to re-learn the most basic things such as eating, swallowing liquids and talking. Although she struggled with her new appearance at first, today Sonya feels more confident than ever thanks to the support of her family and friends. 

Follow Sonya here:
https://www.instagram.com/b_csonya/

Videographer: Pedro Ladeira
Producers: Giacomo Brunelli, Kim Nguyen 
Editor: William Strange

rvtT-hW1_f4.title: My Heart Is Outside My Chest | BORN DIFFERENT
rvtT-hW1_f4.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A BRAVE girl born with a condition that means her heart developed outside of her chest has said she will not let her condition hold her back. Virsaviya Borun-Goncharova, 12, was born with an extremely rare condition called Pentalogy of Cantrell. It caused her rib cage and abdominal muscles to not form properly during her mother’s pregnancy. Now, she shares her condition, lifestyle and passions to her followers to show people that it hasn’t held her back and won’t stop her from pursuing her dreams. Virsaviya, said: “My condition is called Pentalogy of Cantrel, and it basically means that my heart is outside of my ribcage. So it's not protected by my rib cage anymore. I would like to push my limits on what I can and cannot do because I want to inspire other people. I want people to know that I am more than just my heart, I’m beautiful just the way I am. And so are you.”

Follow Virsaviya here: https://www.instagram.com/virsaviya_art_heart/
Virsaviya's mum, Dari: https://www.instagram.com/legendari_love/

Videographer: Carlos De Varona
Producers: Dan Coles & Kim Nguyen 
Editor: Ethan Edwards
