aAIjW8XRUnc.title: Covering Up My $50K Tattoos - But Will I Like it? | TRANSFORMED
aAIjW8XRUnc.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

AFTER covering her body in tattoos, Casey from Tauranga, New Zealand, thought it would be fun to get them covered up for the day - but this isn’t just an exercise in seeing what Casey would look like without tattoos, as she is beginning the process of getting some of her inkings permanently lasered off. Casey estimates she has over 50 tattoos and has spent approximately $50,000 on them. Her most recent tattoo was a large face tattoo, which she has now decided, along with her other face tattoos, to laser off. Working as a venue and general manager for bars and clubs, Casey’s tattoos weren’t a big deal, but after the pandemic hit, Casey changed direction work-wise and has been working with special needs children. This is something she’d love to do more of and she believes removing her face tattoos is a big part of being taken more seriously in other industries. That said, Casey still loves the rest of her tattoos, describing them as “a roadmap of your life” and has no plans to get rid of any of them permanently. 

Follow Casey  Here:
https://www.instagram.com/thetattooedheart/

Videographer: Jake Mokomoko
Producers: Nathalie Bonney, Kim Nguyen

HrCBNuw9aNY.title: After Years Of Hiding - I'm Ready To Embrace My Birthmark | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
HrCBNuw9aNY.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A MUM has embraced her birthmark after years of hiding away and refusing to leave the house without makeup on. Riana Botha, 36, was born with Sturge-Weber syndrome, a rare condition that affects the development of blood cells. As a result, she has a large port-wine stain birthmark on her face. In her younger years, the makeup artist, who lives in South Africa with her husband Hendrik, 33, and daughter Mia-Mari, eight, struggled with her confidence. But becoming a mother changed everything, and now, she feels happy in her own skin. She still has to deal with thoughtless comments from strangers, who ask if her birthmark is the result of a burn or car crash injury. XfNvWSl8pVI.title: I Think My Bald Head Is Sexy - But Will My Blind Date? | DATING DIFFERENT
XfNvWSl8pVI.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

CHIARA ROSE DESANTIS is a 23-year-old single girl living in Los Angeles who first discovered she was losing her hair at 10 years old. A year later, Chiara was diagnosed with alopecia. She told Truly: “When I first started losing my hair, it was very traumatic. I had no idea what was going on and alopecia is a little bit more known now but, you know, 10 years ago, it was almost non-existent.” Dating wasn’t the easiest for Chiara who was teased by boys at school, but she has since found the confidence to go on dating apps. “Dating with alopecia is definitely different. You see it immediately and it’s the first thing you notice." Today, Chiara is going on a blind date with 28-year-old personal trainer, Michael. Will Chiara meet the man who can accept her as she is?

nEU_Me8113w.title: My Look Is 'Nu Metal Goth' - Now I'm Going Girly Glam | TRANSFORMED
nEU_Me8113w.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

DESCRIBING her style as ‘tomboy, nu metal clown’, Shanny - aka Korzkit - draws inspiration for her looks from demonic possessions in film and television as well as 90s music genres. The 25-year-old values individuality in her style and does not plan on changing her look anytime soon. Shanny has 20 tattoos and 10 piercings, including ears stretched to 42mm. Today, she will completely change up her look by undergoing a girly glam transformation. How will she react to her tattoos being covered and swapping the combat boots for heels? Having seen the transformation outfit, Shanny told Truly: “I can’t see myself ever wearing anything like this. I can’t believe it. I’m not a big fan, but I’m excited to see how I look. I’m worried about the shoes...”

coh6ghD-QKE.title: 'Iron Giantess' Shreds 100lbs In Just One Year | BRAND NEW ME
coh6ghD-QKE.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

At her heaviest Laura Micetich AKA “The Iron Giantess” weighed 320lbs. Laura’s weight spiralled out of control due to her unhealthy relationship with food, including binging on doughnuts for breakfast. Fed up with her size, she decided to look into getting a gastric sleeve procedure - which required her to lose some weight beforehand. After mastering a home YouTube workout, she joined the college gym and fell in love with bodybuilding, losing over 100lbs in a year naturally without getting the surgery. Laura now weighs 180lbs and as one of LA’s top fitness coaches, with a number of high-profile clients, has finally come to embrace the childhood nickname she hated - the Iron Giantess. 

Follow Laura on Instagram at:
https://www.instagram.com/theirongiantess/

Thanks to Gold’s Gym for permission to film. Follow them on Instagram at:
https://www.instagram.com/goldsgym/

li8Ir9aCRu4.title: Jessica Alves Reveals Her New Bikini Body | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
li8Ir9aCRu4.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

TRANS woman Jessica Alves has revealed she has gained a shocking 35 kg since starting her transition. The 37-year-old, who was formerly known as 'Human Ken Doll' Rodrigo Alves,  said the combination of Hormone Replacement Therapy and antibiotics for after surgery has caused the weight gain. In a bid to lose the extra pounds as quickly as possible, Jessica flew to Turkey to get gastric sleeve surgery. Jessica's stomach was reduced in size by 75%, allowing her to lose a kilogram per day over the course of two weeks. During her stay in Turkey she has also been receiving the 'Robolex' treatment, which uses ultrasonic radio frequencies to burn fat cells. Happier than ever with her new look, Jessica is ready to reveal her bikini body as a woman for the first time ever. Jessica told Truly: "It's amazing to wear a swimming suit like this, which I was never able to wear before – I feel really comfortable and happy".

Follow Jessica here:
https://www.instagram.com/jessicaalvesuk/

Videographer: Dinçer Oruçoğlu
Producers: Giacomo Brunelli, Charles Richards

ymJC6aym6bM.title: From Tattooed Tomboy To Girly Glam | TRANSFORMED
ymJC6aym6bM.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

HOLLY loves tattoos so much, before the Covid19 pandemic began, she would get a new tattoo once a month. Describing her style as androgynous and tomboy, Holly has tattoos on the side of her head, while her neck and forearms are inked entirely black and she wears her hair short and bleached. Holly got her first tattoo when she was 18 but started getting more heavily tattooed from age 21 and is aiming for 80% coverage. Holly says she has been a tomboy “from the womb” and she typically dresses in oversized tees and shorts or ripped jeans from unisex or men’s brands, including her own clothing line. Holly wore trousers at school and was head girl. Everyone expected her to wear a suit at prom so she wore a black and blue corset with a black skirt. However, In her current wardrobe she has no skirts or dresses and has never worn heels. What then will she make of a girly glam transformation with a dress straight out of prom? 

Follow Holly Here: https://www.instagram.com/holly_inked/ 

Clothing line: https://www.instagram.com/moonboi_designs/

Holly got her first tattoo when she was 18 but started getting more heavily tattooed from age 21 and is aiming for 80% coverage. Holly says she has been a tomboy “from the womb” and she typically dresses in oversized tees and shorts or ripped jeans from unisex or men’s brands, including her own clothing line. Holly wore trousers at school and was head girl. Everyone expected her to wear a suit at prom so she wore a black and blue corset with a black skirt. However, In her current wardrobe she has no skirts or dresses and has never worn heels. What then will she make of a girly glam transformation with a dress straight out of prom? 

Follow Holly Here: https://www.instagram.com/holly_inked/

JiW7o4oOi-4.title: The Boyfriend And Girlfriend With Butterfly Skin | BORN DIFFERENT
JiW7o4oOi-4.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A YOUNG couple from the US have found love after sharing their experiences with an incredibly rare skin condition. Ariana, 21, and Victor, 25, both have Epidermolysis Bullosa (EB), which causes the skin to tear and break easily. Ariana and Victor met on Facebook two years ago, but the COVID pandemic kept them separated in different states. After reuniting for Ariana’s college graduation, Victor told Truly: “The first thing I noticed about Ariana was her confidence. She’s comfortable in her body and she’s not afraid of what others may think.” Ariana raises awareness of her condition across social media, but she’s often received judgement for her relationship with Victor. She said: “There was a lot of negativity. People judge our looks, they say: 'What are we doing to each other?’ And we shouldn’t be together. I still choose to post whatever I want and to share our relationship." Ariana admits there are lots of benefits of sharing the same condition as Victor: She added: “It allows us to understand each other more and talk more in depth about our illness without feeling judged or criticised. We can feel more comfortable with each other."

GlL6JDJvzgI.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

TERRI and Lee Blackley are “out and proud swingers”, who have reached a point in their relationship where they would like to introduce another woman permanently. The couple met online five years ago, and within six months had opened up their relationship and entered the world of swinging. Once they made that decision, Terri described it to Truly as: “Entering a world they never knew existed and wanting to learn more and more everyday." Their very first threesome together was with an older woman, and the pair haven’t looked back since. They both feel that opening up their relationship sexually has made them stronger, and love meeting like-minded people. The couple are keen to explore polyamory, and are now actively looking for a long term female partner to join them in a throuple. Tonight, they have a hot date lined up and the pressure is on to impress. 

Videographer: Sam Wilkinson
Producers: Joel Ross and Ruby Coote
Editor: Sonia Estal

fJLl3qBb6VM.title: My Boyfriend's Never Seen Me Without Tatts - Until Now | TRANSFORMED
fJLl3qBb6VM.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

FOR Sarah Sabbath, it is pretty difficult to go anywhere unnoticed. The 26-year-old from El Paso, Texas got her first tattoo at the age of 14 and has kept going ever since. Sarah, who is a tattoo artist, is now 85% covered in tattoos having spent just over $5,000. The self-confessed ‘tattoo addict’ feels empowered when she looks in the mirror and said: “I would describe my aesthetic as modern art.” Sarah has not seen herself without tattoos for 13 years and is curious as to what she will look like - so today, a makeup artist will be covering them up. How will she react to seeing herself in the mirror? And what will her best friend, Heather and her boyfriend, Doubt make of this transformation?

BNuQB2S52dw.title: My Mum Kicked Me Out For Getting Pregnant At 16 | LOVE DON'T JUDGE
BNuQB2S52dw.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A YOUNG TEEN couple have had a baby - causing them to lose friends and family. Cheyenne first met Donye online, when they were both in middle school. The couple talked for a long time online, before they finally met up in person. The teens then dated for a little while, but not long after dating Cheyenne realised she had fallen pregnant with Avielle. Cheyenne thought that a teen pregnancy was something that only happened in the movies or on TV, but decided early on she wanted to keep the baby. On breaking the news to her mum that she was pregnant and going to keep the child, Cheyenne was told to leave the family home. Fortunately for Cheyenne, after a couple of weeks of living with her grandparents, Cheyenne’s mum welcomed her back home. Unfortunately, Cheyenne and Donye also lost friends during the pregnancy, mostly because they no longer have the time to hangout with them anymore...

SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A TEENAGER from Liberia is hoping to have life-changing surgery to remove an enormous growth on his leg. Charles, 16, has Neurofibromatosis, which causes tumours to grow along his nerves. The rare condition was first noticed by his father, Charles Sr., when he spotted a small black mole on his son’s leg. The tumour now weighs around 5kg and makes life incredibly difficult for Charles. He told Truly: “It can be heavy for me to walk, it can be heavy to move. I can’t go to school and it can be hard to play with my friends.” Charles Sr. says people haven’t always been sympathetic to his son’s condition. He said: “When little children come and they see him, they pass and they run. Some children are afraid when they see the foot.” Now, two Liberian charities, Legacy Holding Foundation and Liberian Women Advocacy Network International, are working together to find a surgeon who can remove the growth. Dr Richards, from local hospital AMI Liberia, told Truly: “I think the leg has gotten bigger since we first saw him. It has become more plexiform, meaning it has folded upon itself." Charles, who wants to be an electrician when he’s older, is staying positive, and hopes he can get the treatment he desperately needs. When asked about his plans after the potential surgery, Charles said: “I will be happy to run with my friends. I will be the happiest man on earth.”

Charles’ GoFundMe page:
https://uk.gofundme.com/f/operation-save-charles-tarway?qid=665bcf088201c832bada87f276135093 

Videographer: Orlind Cooper
Producers: Cecily Snowball and Tom Buckman
Editor: Hailey Wang

ALC_RJS2UE8.title: I Get Ghosted Because Of My Curved Spine | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
ALC_RJS2UE8.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

27-YEAR-OLD photographer Becky Dann from London, UK was born with Kyphoscoliosis – a severe curvature of the spine. Becky’s condition deteriorated over the years, resulting in her spine collapsing at the age of 10, and having to use a wheelchair to get around. The curvature of the spine has also affected Becky’s height, she’s 4ft 7". Becky was bullied during high school, which severely affected her confidence. “I tried to hide my disability, I grew my hair long, wore baggy clothes, I avoided mirrors and didn’t like looking at myself,” Becky told Truly. It wasn’t until college that Becky started to realise that although she was “different”, that wasn’t necessarily a bad thing. Finding her confidence resulted in Becky starting a photography project called “I’m Fine”, featuring self portraits that highlighted her scoliosis. “I did it because I always felt like people treated me as if I’m fragile, just because I have a disability,” she added. Becky entered her photographs into a competition, resulting in her pictures going viral; “Suddenly I was very aware that my body and my disability was so public, and I was worried about what the response might be, but to my surprise it was very positive.” Becky now uses her social media platform to inspire others and show her disability for what it is. “My self-confidence has grown so much, I like who I am and I would never change my body.” 

Follow Becky here: https://www.instagram.com/beckydann/

Videographer: Jonathan Constantinou
Producers: Stephanie Stijkel, Tom Buckman 
Editor: Tani McDowell

Now you can watch our videos in Spanish!:  http://bit.ly/Suscribirse_truly_ES

gvsbFzhNPDQ.title: I've Had 30 Procedures - On My Face | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
gvsbFzhNPDQ.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A MAN from Chihuahua, Mexico who wants to look like a real-life Ken doll has revealed his latest procedure to his mum and best friend. 28-year-old Criss has had over 30 procedures on his face so far, and claims he has just started. As well as getting two rhinoplasties, Criss has lost count of how many fillers he's had so far. Starting at 18 years old, Criss has had injections in his lips, cheeks, nose, forehead and chin. Criss told Truly: "Growing up I was bullied a lot so I always wanted to be perfect, be cute, be beautiful, be accepted - it became a little obsession." Not yet satisfied with how he looks, Criss is always seeking new ways to perfect his image, and is now getting the popular 'Foxy eyes' procedure.

Follow Criss here: https://www.instagram.com/crisskendoll/

Videographer: Fernando Poire V
Producers: Giacomo Brunelli, Tom Buckman

SvdKtpVNITw.title: I Was Shot 9 Times - But It Hasn't Stopped Me Dancing | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
SvdKtpVNITw.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

IT HAD started off as a good day. After watching her brother’s football game, Diamond agreed to give a friend of a friend a ride, in exchange for gas money. But when she didn’t recognise the neighbourhood she was in, Diamond started to get concerned. She parked up and he got out to meet two men, asking Diamond to wait. When he got back in the car and told Diamond to drive off quickly, she knew things weren’t ok. But before she could even drive away, Diamond and her passenger were shot at by an AK47 and AR15. A total of 79 bullet holes were found in her car and nine bullets hit Diamond: three in the chest, two in the back, one in the left arm, one in the right leg and one in each kneecap. A month into her recovery in the hospital, Diamond woke up to learn that she was a paraplegic. For Diamond, the question was less if she would be able to walk and more if she would be able to dance again. Having danced and performed since she was just three years old, Diamond was relieved to discover she could still dance in her wheelchair and before the pandemic was performing with dancers both in and out of wheelchairs. When lockdown hit, Diamond took to TikTok, recording routines that she shared online. But now is the first time she is getting to perform in real life again for over two years. 

Follow Diamond here:
https://www.instagram.com/diamondsg_/

Videographer: Collins White
Producers: Nathalie Bonney, Martha Hewitt
Editor: Sebastian Heseltine

Now you can watch our videos in Spanish!:  http://bit.ly/Suscribirse_truly_ES

pc6RgCqSmIo.title: My Wife Realised She's Bi - Now We Share A Girlfriend | LOVE DON'T JUDGE
pc6RgCqSmIo.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A MARRIED couple have discovered they are polyamarous after falling in love and forming a throuple with another woman. Portland based couple Eli and Mikey, had been together for 16 years as a straight, monogamous couple, before they met Alida on a camping trip. In spite of the throuple’s clear love and acceptance of one another, the relationship has not been without its judgement. This has often manifested itself in the form of stares and comments from strangers, but the triad don’t hide their affection and defy the looks by holding hands and showing their love in public. Online, the comments about their relationship are easier to ignore, but Mikey admits those that suggest they are “destroying their kids” can be hurtful. 

Follow Eli, Mikey and Alida here:
https://www.instagram.com/teamtriadtribe/ 

Videographer: Taylor Bluemel
Producers: Frazer Randalls and Charles Richards
Editor: Akash Beri

XVQ3_tgjPkI.title: I Had My First Boob Job At 16 - And I've Had 5 More Since | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
XVQ3_tgjPkI.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A VINTAGE fashion collector is proving that fashion from 2000-2009 can be a lifestyle, not just a trend. Ivana Vladislava, from Germany, is obsessed with the noughties era style. In her current vintage clothes collection she has items worn by Jennifer Lopez, Paris Hilton and Pamela Anderson, which individually never cost her more than $100. But that’s what Ivana loves - big labels for a small price. Ivana, who was born a man, always knew she wanted to live her life as a woman and at 16 she got her first boob job. As Ivana got older and in pursuit of her 2000’s it-girl image, she got a further five breast jobs, six nose jobs, two BBLs (Brazilian Butt Lifts), a jawline reduction, a forehead reduction, a brow lift and multiple liposuctions. Ivana isn’t sure how much she’s spent in total, but tells us she’s invested every penny into her procedures. For Ivana, whose age is a ‘medical mystery’, the procedures have been a great success and she has zero regrets.

Videographer: Nikita Pavlov
Producers: Frazer Randalls, Ruby Coote
Editor: Gary Sykes

oEN1d2MSRQ0.title: I Spend $3K A Month To Look Like Kim K | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
oEN1d2MSRQ0.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A KIM KARDASHIAN lookalike has revealed that she spends up to $4,000 a month keeping up with her look. Ashten, from California, has been told for years that she is a dead ringer for the reality TV star, but it was not until she was scouted by a Clint Eastwood lookalike, that she realised she could cash in. Now, she earns up to $6,000 for a single gig. wFUURuHoAWk.title: The 6-Year-Old Who's Ageing Too Fast | BORN DIFFERENT
wFUURuHoAWk.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A LITTLE boy from Germany is living with an extremely rare genetic condition which sees him age eight times faster than the average person. Luke Bohm, six, was born with Progeria, which occurs in around one out of eight million people, and there are only around 120 cases known worldwide. His dad, Ronny, has dedicated his life to helping Luke experience as much as possible with the life-limiting condition. He told Truly: “I quit my job immediately, I have no time to work. Eight hours work that's eight hours less for Luke and for me in life." Part of living life with Progeria means Luke isn’t able to grow as a regular child would, but physiotherapists say his body is around that of a 60-year-old. For Ronny, he’ll stop at nothing to help prolong Luke’s life. As well as sharing Luke’s story on social media to almost half-a-million followers, he’s also raising money in the hope of seeking treatment in the US which they currently can’t get in Germany. Ronny added: “When Luke is going to bed in the evening and he says: ‘Dad, this was a good day, my mission is completed for this day.’ Our time is very limited and that's why we make the best of it every day." 

Follow Luke and his family's story here:

TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@supportluke
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCKtZulxeOEOGoQLnpkNLHVw/videos

MJaSwqHdOeE.description:

OSCAR Duke is living a bling lifestyle as London's 'Prince Charming'. He's a singer-songwriter, model, entrepreneur and influencer from a very well-connected family who spends thousands on his face, goes to luxury parties and has fabulous friends. But Oscar's life isn't perfect: he struggles with dating thanks to his lifestyle. 7Biy_aIbIxY.title: I Lost 170lbs Eating Out | BRAND NEW ME
7Biy_aIbIxY.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

36-YEAR-OLD Chelsey Bishop from Tucson, Arizona lost an incredible 170lbs through a ketogenic way of eating. Weighing in at 340lbs at her heaviest, Chelsey was consuming between 4,000 to 5,000 calories a day. The excess weight was increasingly affecting Chelsey’s health, suffering from a high blood pressure and on the cusp of becoming diabetic. She told Truly: “Before my weight loss I was in denial about how much my weight affected my life, eating was my comfort and made me feel happier.” And her wake up call happened on a day out at a theme park, Chelsey explained: “I got on a rollercoaster, sat on the seat and the lap bar wouldn’t latch over my body. That was one of the most mortifying moments of my life.” Chelsey started researching dieting and came across a friend who had lost 100lbs through a ketogenic way of eating. Chelsey continued: “I thought if she can do it, I can do it, I started the keto diet and that changed everything.” Losing half of her body weight, Chelsey is the ultimate example of a successful Keto dieter. However, she approaches the diet very differently to most: “A lot of keto followers preach against eating out, but I hate cooking, my type of food prep is looking at the menu before I go to a restaurant.” With a big following on Instagram and YouTube as the “Ketohalfasser”, Chelsey is the ultimate proof that you can eat out and still lose weight. 

Follow Chelsey here: 
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/ketohalfasser/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ketohalfasser/

Videographer: Mike Myers
Producers: Stephanie Stijkel, James Thorne
Editor: Alex Lubetkin

bPPrSfr930k.title: Doctors Are Baffled By My Mystery Skin Condition | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
bPPrSfr930k.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

NANCY, 17, from England suffers a chronic skin condition that causes flare-ups on her face with bruise-like red patches and stinging pain. The flare-ups happen sporadically and without warning. It first started happening when she was just 11 years old and what started as a few patches, now covers up to 70% of her face. Despite constant visits to the doctors Nancy and her family have been unable to reach a diagnosis. Initially Nancy felt self-conscious about her face and would cover it with thick makeup but she now feels confident enough to go without it - be that out in public with friends and family or on social media, where she has amassed an incredible following on TikTok with over 1 million subscribers. The influencer is using her platform to encourage other women and girls to celebrate their own bare faces. 

Follow her here: 
https://vm.tiktok.com/ZMeMJT26n/
https://www.instagram.com/nancy.xox/?hl=en

Videographer: Nick Hamer

dDJC-EISJtg.title: My Kids Dislike My Extreme Plastic Surgery - But Why Should I Stop? | MY EXTRAORDINARY FAMILY
dDJC-EISJtg.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

GLAMOUR model Allegra Cole has eight children and receives judgement from her family and others for the way she looks. Allegra told Truly: “My teens strongly dislike my plastic surgery lifestyle choices. We have a large family so we stand out and that's going to be a recipe for drawing a lot of eyes. I feel when they first meet me that they have a preconceived notion because of my look.” However, having a Mormon upbringing has shaped Allegra as a mother - especially with her fundamental values and taking care of each other. “I believe that I'm raising daughters to be strong, I also believe that I'm raising men who are boys who are not afraid to be with a strong independent woman.” And regardless of what other people might say, Allegra must keep on top of her look due to the nature of her business... 

Follow Allegra Here: https://www.instagram.com/allegracoleworld/

evOyR1gXRtE.title: I'm LA's Most Plastic Fantastic Sugar Baby | BLING LIFE
evOyR1gXRtE.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

GARRETT, 20, is LA’s most fantastic sugar baby with the expensive taste to match - he enjoys dining in the fanciest restaurants, loves luxury cars, adores designer fashion and spends $10K a month on his beauty regime. All of this is easy when it’s funded by someone else - Garrett told Truly he has “several sugar daddies who allow for this fabulous lifestyle”. This is a far cry from the small town in Indiana where he grew up. His conservative Christian family weren’t accepting of his sexuality, and Garrett had to conform to their rules when living at home. During the ages of 14-17 his parents would take him to gay conversion therapy and weekends were spent in church. Now living in LA, Garrett has established a strong group of like minded friends who support his lifestyle choices and have become like family. Tonight he has brought them all together as he celebrates his first year living in LA and a new lease of life. 

Videographer: Istvan Lettang
Producers: Joel Ross, Ruby Coote
Editor: Sonia Estal

localized.title: I'm LA's Most Plastic Fantastic Sugar Baby | BLING LIFE
localized.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

GARRETT, 20, is LA’s most fantastic sugar baby with the expensive taste to match - he enjoys dining in the fanciest restaurants, loves luxury cars, adores designer fashion and spends $10K a month on his beauty regime. All of this is easy when it’s funded by someone else - Garrett told Truly he has “several sugar daddies who allow for this fabulous lifestyle”. This is a far cry from the small town in Indiana where he grew up. His conservative Christian family weren’t accepting of his sexuality, and Garrett had to conform to their rules when living at home. During the ages of 14-17 his parents would take him to gay conversion therapy and weekends were spent in church. Now living in LA, Garrett has established a strong group of like minded friends who support his lifestyle choices and have become like family. Tonight he has brought them all together as he celebrates his first year living in LA and a new lease of life. 

Videographer: Istvan Lettang
Producers: Joel Ross, Ruby Coote
Editor: Sonia Estal
Series Producers: Jon Eastman, Charley Sutton

rAf5gte3T-o.title: My Rapunzel Hair Is 5ft 4" Long | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
rAf5gte3T-o.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A REAL life Rapunzel whose hair measures 5ft 4" has pledged that she will never cut her mane. Alla Perkova, 37, from Odessa, Ukraine, was inspired by her mother who also had 3-foot-long flowing hair. Alla claims she only had her hair trimmed twice when she was a child and has been growing it since then. After graduating from university with a law degree, she decided to pursue her dream and became a model and actress. When she began sharing images of her long hair online, she received an overwhelming amount of support and admiration from the likes of celebrities, including supermodel Candice Swanepoel. Alla's unique look also turns heads wherever she goes, with passersby asking for snaps with her. Every year, Alla attends a local child beauty pageant, named after her, and crowns young girls who are inspired to look like her with long hair.

Follow Alla here: https://www.instagram.com/alla_perkova/

Videographer: Aleksey Solodunov
Producers: Emilia Jiang, Tom Buckman
Editor: Sarah-Jayne Gaplin

87TlwRPDAcM.title: Plastic Surgery Mom Has A Makeunder - & She Hates It  | TRANSFORMED
87TlwRPDAcM.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

ELAINA Starr 32, from Queens New York is not your average all-American mom. She has spent $170,000 on 11 major plastic surgeries and over 500 procedures to transform her body. Her more extreme surgeries have included three Brazilian butt lifts, two tummy tucks and a corseting procedure. Going under the knife has led to dramatic medical complications, recently she contracted sepsis, and has previously almost bled to death in ER. In this episode of Transformed Elaina is turned from her usual "very glam, and sparkly" look to a much more dowdy version of herself. "I think style-wise a lot of moms dress for comfort," Elaina said. "It's easy for them to wear baggy clothes and just throw on whatever.” How will her son react to seeing his mom looking ‘average’ for the first time?

For more follow:
https://www.instagram.com/elainastarrxx/
https://www.instagram.com/schanicapickensbeauty/

Videographer: Cameron Wheeless
Producers: Nathalie Bonney, James Thorne

zoWat3zWcj8.title: From Goth To $24K 'Fetish Barbie' | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
zoWat3zWcj8.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A GOTHIC rock fan has spent €20,000 transforming herself into 'an inflatable doll'. Fetisch Barbie, 27, from Vienna, Austria, says she has an obsession with plastic surgery - especially with lip fillers. As a teenager, she started listening to rock music and was drawn to the goth scene. At school, she was constantly criticised by other students and teachers for the way she dressed. But judgement didn't stop Fetisch Barbie from pursuing her ideal look as she later fell in love with the world of 'bimbofication'. After getting her first lip filler at 18, she hasn't stopped having them ever since. She is also considering undergoing another breast augmentation after having her first one at 19. Her boyfriend, Daniel, loves her 'fetish doll' look but is worried about her going too far...

Follow Fetisch Barbie here: https://www.instagram.com/fetischbarbie/

Videographer: Lukas Lerperger
Producers: Emilia Jiang, Ruby Coote, Charles Richards
Editor: Helen Mckee

ZYURdAa-iTs.title: The Girl Born Without A Nose | BORN DIFFERENT
ZYURdAa-iTs.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A LITTLE girl born without a nose due to an ultra-rare genetic condition is due to have a brand new, 3D-printed nose implant fitted. Tessa Evans, 8, from County Derry, N. Ireland, is one of only 100 people in the world with Bosma arhinia microphthalmia (BAM) syndrome. When she was two, Tessa was the first person in the world to have a nasal implant made using 3D technology. At age four a larger nasal implant was fitted, but that subsequently had to be removed after becoming infected. Now Tessa’s medical team, led by Dr Juling Ong, at Great Ormond Street Hospital for Children in London, are planning to insert a new implant next year and young Tessa can’t help but be thrilled at the thought of finally having a nose. She said: “I can’t wait for my new nose, it’s going to make me really happy.”

To donate to Tessa’s fundraising page, visit:
https://gogetfunding.com/tessa-born-extraordinary/

Follow Tessa’s journey on social media: 
Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/tessabornextraordinary/
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/bornwithoutanose/

Videographer: Carl Best
Producers: Camile Rocha-Keys, Kim Nguyen
Editor: Josh Halil

eTw9I7IXJx0.title: I Don't Need Your Pity - I'm Living My Influencer Dream | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
eTw9I7IXJx0.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A DISABLED INFLUENCER wants to be the role model she never saw herself as a child. Kartier Rose, 23, was born with spinal muscular atrophy - a progressive condition that causes the muscles to get weaker over time. She has been in a wheelchair virtually her entire life, and endured horrendous bullying as a child, with her tormentors even accusing her of faking her disability. But Kartier, of Bradford, UK, refuses to be held back, and has now become a successful influencer. On her YouTube and Instagram pages, she shares beauty tutorials, fashion tips and an insight into the realities of life with a disability. She also does modelling, and has even launched her own line of vegan false lashes. Kartier said: "I loved reading fashion magazines as a child, but disabled people were underrepresented. Seeing models that looked like me would have massively helped my confidence."

You can follow Kartier here:
https://www.instagram.com/kartierrose/
https://www.tiktok.com/@kartierrose

Thank you to Alice Webb for providing photography for this project. 
See more of her work at:
https://www.alicewebb.photography/

Videographer: Ryan Jackson
Producers: Erin Cardiff, Ruby Coote
Editor: Giulia Bassanese

1j8KveaIw40.title: I Was Attacked With Acid - But I Still Feel Beautiful | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
1j8KveaIw40.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A WOMAN who survived an acid attack says she still feels beautiful, despite being mutilated for life. Esther Jimenez, 37, was doused with a concoction commonly known as 'devil acid', by a stranger in 2011, whilst working at a cafe in the Dominican Republic. She suffered second and third-degree burns on her face and body and lost her eye. Her injuries were so severe her children could not even recognise her. She has undergone 28 surgeries to reconstruct her face, maimed by an attacker who has never been caught. Despite the ordeal, Esther has learned to embrace her appearance by regularly sharing photos and videos of herself on social media. She is also campaigning to lift the stigma around burn victims and promote tougher punishments for such attacks.

You can follow Esther on Instagram:
https://www.instagram.com/jimenez.esther/

Videographer: Julian Roa
Producers: Emilia Jiang, Ruby Coote
Editor: Pete Ansell

yvkDNTdqm1o.title: I Went From Banking To Bimbo | BRAND NEW ME
yvkDNTdqm1o.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

MEET the woman who gave up a corporate job to become a real-life 'bimbo' and OnlyFans model. For years Rebecca, 30, from London, worked in the banking world, where she was required to wear bland businesswear. But after her health deteriorated due to Ehlers-Danlos syndrome (EDS) and she was forced to stop working, Rebecca decided to lean-in to her dream of being a real life bimbo on OnlyFans. Having been obsessed with Barbies and Pamela Anderson since a young age, she fully embraced the bimbo aesthetic - wearing mostly pink, getting a breast augmentation and frequent cosmetic treatments including lip fillers and botox to maintain her bimbo look. 

Videographer: Aaron Witchard
Producers: Tom Midlane, Charles Richards
Editor: Athina Chatzidaki

OPqBj4L1FNo.title: I'm The $1 Million Barbie Of Miami | BLING LIFE
OPqBj4L1FNo.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

LIVING in luxury is an every-day experience for a businesswoman and model who has spent over $1 million on enhancing her body. Klara Lima lives a lavish lifestyle, partying on yachts and eating the finest cuisine courtesy of her chef husband. But it has been a long journey for Miami-based Klara, who is now completely sober after battling addiction and eating disorders for years. Klara, who is originally from the Czech Republic, told Truly: “I spend a lot of money on fashion and beauty. That’s where a lot of my money goes as it is my passion. It’s part of my self-expression and my art and I definitely enjoy traveling, great food, and great trips.”

You can find Klara at: https://www.instagram.com/theklaralima/

IanewtnOC0A.title: The Twin Sisters Who Share A Body | BORN DIFFERENT
IanewtnOC0A.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

SISTERS Valentina and Heloá are literally ‘joined at the hip’. The 18-month-old conjoined twins, from Goiânia, Brazil, were born sharing hips, an abdomen, liver and intestines. The twins are due to be separated using a pioneering technique that involves producing a 3D map of their anatomy. But before that, surgeon Dr Zacharias Calil and his team will have to insert inflatable silicone bags under their skin, which can be gradually inflated over time to create new skin, ready for when they are separated. And despite the risks of surgery, the twins’ parents are adamant that it is the right step for their daughters since it will enable them to live independent lives.   

To donate to the twins’ life-changing separation surgery, visit:
http://vaka.me/1354302

Videographer: Pedro Ladeira Tavares
Producers: Camile Rocha-Keys, Ruby Coote
Editor: Alex Lubetkin
Fixer: Marilia Marasciulo

tYLy_4-EIFM.title: I've Spent $100K To Achieve Plastic Perfection | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
tYLy_4-EIFM.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

JOEY PRIXX has spent over $100,000 on transforming his body into what he sees as 'perfect'. Born and raised in Westwood, Boston, Joey was a shy and creative child, and always had a strong vision regarding how he wanted to look. At the age of 20, Joey got his first nose job. Since then, he has had over 100 procedures and 50 body piercings. Joey told Truly: “I love the way that I look! I wanted to transform my body because I don't want to be like everyone else. The look that I wanted to achieve was just something that you don't see every day when you're walking down the street.” As well as spending time on perfecting his look, Joey has a busy schedule running Superficial ModSpa, where he advises and performs procedures on his clients. “It's something I had wanted to do for a really long time. I wanted to design a studio that was one of a kind just like myself, but a place where I could help others reach their aesthetic goals." 

Follow Joey here: https://www.instagram.com/joeyprixx/
Superficial ModSpa: https://superficialmodspa.com/

Videographer: Colin Bell
Producers: Dav Rich, Charles Richards
Editor: Shiona Penrake

Oe6dsj4SHqY.title: I Got A Divorce - And Lost 250lbs | BRAND NEW ME
Oe6dsj4SHqY.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A MUM-OF-TWO has had her loose skin removed after losing a whopping 250lbs. Crystal from Texas, USA was once 420lbs and struggling with her health. After seeing a doctor, they recommended gastric bypass surgery to Crystal. Unfortunately after the surgery, Crystal’s bad habits meant the weight came piling back. Crystal began exercising and went on a strict keto diet -  altogether she has lost 250lbs. Due to the amount of weight Crystal has lost, she was left with a huge amount of excess skin all over her body. At the beginning of 2021, she had a lower body lift and an arm lift - and she has now shown off her new look to her best friend for the first time.

Follow Crystal here: 
https://www.instagram.com/crystyle817/

Videographer: Michael Rowley
Producers: Shannon Lane, Kim Nguyen

otNbp5arKHs.title: I Was Bored Of Racing Cars - So I Became A Glamour Model | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
otNbp5arKHs.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A FORMER professional race car driver has used cosmetic procedures to reinvent herself as a glamour model. Renee Gracie, from Australia, started racing when she was just a teen. Initially she raced go-karts for fun, but by 18 years old she was racing professionally. However, after six years as a professional, Renee decided that the sport was no longer right for her. Renee, who initially was unsure of what she would do next, was spurred into glamour modelling by her extensive fan base. Having already had one boob job at age 19, Renee took the decision to get more work to further enhance her look. To date she has paid for two Brazilian Butt Lifts, two boob jobs, veneers and filler, at a total cost of over $60,000. Renee hopes to one day return to racing, but for now says "my life is the best it’s ever been and I’m the happiest I’ve ever been."

fcrC5e_ChTk.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A WOMAN born with a shortened leg and missing arm has defied the odds to become a fashion model. Zizipho Soldati, 26, from Johannesburg, South Africa, has phocomelia, a rare congenital condition that causes limb mutation and deformity. As a child, she was shunned by others who believed she was 'cursed'. But as she grew older, she refused to hide away her disability and proudly showed off her body in bikinis and chic outfits on social media. As an influencer and award-winning filmmaker, Zizipo strives to inspire others to follow their dreams by sharing her journey to self-acceptance and body positivity.

You can follow Zizipho on Instagram:

PlTSgzksrGI.title: The Man With 1000 Tumours | BORN DIFFERENT
PlTSgzksrGI.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A MAN in India with one of the world’s most extreme skin conditions is desperately seeking life-changing surgery to help put his life back on track. Diwakar Bisoye, 67, from Odisha, India, says lumps began appearing when he was 14 or 15 and quickly spread from head to toe, leaving him with thousands of bubble-like tumours. The colossal 66lb tumour on his thigh makes it difficult for Diwakar to walk and means he is reliant on his wife of 35 years, Dobani, and his children to support him financially. Despite his hardships, Diwakar hasn't let his condition isolate him or close himself off from other people and he is now hoping that he can one day get surgery to remove his thigh tumour and let him walk the streets freely. 

Videographer: Haziq Qadri
Producers: Tom Midlane, Tom Buckman
Editor: Tani McDowell

ZLE_f0JZs7Q.title: The 14-Year-Old Who Can Deadlift 235lbs | MIAMI MUSCLE
ZLE_f0JZs7Q.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

14-YEAR-OLD Brooklynn Sittner has big dreams. She’s a CrossFit fanatic, who began the sport aged seven. She has now been training for half her life and hopes to one day compete professionally at the games. Last year Brooklynn became the national champion for Olympic weightlifting in her age group, an achievement that took hours of dedication, and stepping outside of normal teenage existence. She fits in homeschooling in the morning and spends the rest of her day at the gym. “I train six days a week, I get to the gym about noon, I leave anywhere from seven to eight,” she said. Brooklynn trains with her father Cory, who is also her coach. Despite the pressure of their relentless workout schedule, he isn’t concerned about creating a family rift. He said it had “positively impacted our father-daughter relationship, it allows us to be together every day and challenge each other.” 

Follow Brooklynn and Cory here - 
https://www.instagram.com/queen_beezy13/?hl=en
https://www.instagram.com/smashdaddysit/?hl=en

Thank you to Codi Jean Borner for use of her photos https://www.instagram.com/codi.jeanphotography/

5Ytd81ALOPI.title: I'm 17 & Make $100k A Month | BLING LIFE
5Ytd81ALOPI.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

MAKING $100,000 a month as a teen is something most dream of, but one young entrepreneur has made it a reality. Pierce Woodward started his own business making rings out of vintage spoons in his parent’s garage after dropping out of high school at 16. The Florida teen has since seen huge success, upgrading from a garage to an entire brand house and making rings for social media giants such as Noah Beck, Dixie D'Amelio, and Jules LeBlanc. Pierce told Truly: “I’ve had a goal since I was a little kid to save up six figures by the time I was 18. I finally have been able to accomplish that. The coolest thing about having money is just knowing I can do anything I want whenever I want. But I always want to do more and more and more and keep building bigger and bigger and bigger.” The enterprising 17-year-old has already managed to buy a house for his family, as well as three cars for himself, including a supercharged Range Rover, a Maserati, and a convertible Mustang. He conducts all his marketing through social media and has built up around d 160,000 followers on Instagram and 1.5 million on Tik Tok. Recently, Pierce was able to give his mum $50,000 in cash to go and buy her dream car – a convertible Corvette.

You can find Pierce at: https://www.instagram.com/pierce_woodward/
And on TikTok at: https://www.tiktok.com/@pierce_woodward

Videographer: Carlos De Varona
Producers: Joe Roberts, Kim Nguyen
Editor: Paul Zeller

KYtso1tKYgU.title: Born Without Limbs - Now I'm Marrying My Dream Man | LOVE DON'T JUDGE
KYtso1tKYgU.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

GABE Adams, 22, from Utah, was born without arms and legs due to Hanhart syndrome. But Gabe hasn’t let his lack of limbs stop him from accomplishing whatever he sets his mind to - including marrying the man of his dreams. Gabe was adopted from Brazil as a baby by a Mormon family, and his religious upbringing meant that he remained in the closet until he was 19. However, Gabe is now proudly out to his friends, family and the world and after a string of disappointing relationships, he has found true love with his fiance Adam. We caught up with the young couple in the lead-up to them tying the knot this summer, with Gabe excited to get his first sneak peek at his bespoke wedding outfit. 

Follow Gabe on Instagram at:
https://www.instagram.com/no_limbs_/
https://www.instagram.com/limbitlessgabe/

Gabe’s wedding outfit and sketch courtesy of fashion designer Michelle Hébert:

https://www.michellehebert.com/

m98rNz_8_wk.title: One of My Breasts Never Grew | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
m98rNz_8_wk.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A WOMAN with a rare muscle disorder has grown to love her uneven chest so much that she has even turned down free surgery. Becca, 23, of Barnsley, South Yorkshire, was around 15 when she first noticed that her chest was lopsided. Over time, her breasts became increasingly uneven until she was an A cup on the left side, and a D on the right. Aged 18, she was diagnosed with Poland Syndrome - where the muscles do not develop on one side of the body. At first, she would wear a prosthetic breast and hide beneath baggy jumpers. But then, she realised that she could use her story to help others. Now, she regularly posts online about Poland Syndrome and has ditched her prosthetic. She has also found love with 23-year-old Kyle. Becca concluded: "Growing up, I felt alone in dealing with Poland Syndrome. I don't want anyone else to feel that way."

Videographer: Scott Dulson
Producers: Erin Cardiff, Ruby Coote
Editor: Sarah-Jayne Galpin

Now you can watch our videos in Spanish!:  http://bit.ly/Suscribirse_truly_ES

She has also found love with 23-year-old Kyle. Becca concluded: "Growing up, I felt alone in dealing with Poland Syndrome. I don't want anyone else to feel that way."

Videographer: Scott Dulson
Producers: Erin Cardiff, Ruby Coote
Editor: Sarah-Jayne Galpin

pYSoavWFM4c.title: Ignore The Haters - I Love Being 'Fat' | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
pYSoavWFM4c.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A MODEL is fighting back against fatphobia by launching an all-plus-size burlesque troupe. When Carina Shero - known on social media as Unskinny Shero - now 32, first moved from Germany to the USA aged 18, she felt that media representation of larger women like her was lacking. Determined to spread body positivity, she began sharing photos and videos of herself posing in lingerie and figure-hugging outfits online. Her posts have received outpouring support as well as judgment and hate - but she refuses to let trolls bring her down. As part of her mission to challenge beauty standards and show the world that larger bodies can be sexy, too, she co-founded 'The Femme FATales', one of the first all-plus-size burlesque troupes in Chicago. 

Videographer: Dan Peters
Producers: Emilia Jiang, Kim Nguyen
Editor: Ian Phillips

KBdwzneGHAY.title: I Lost My Limbs When I Was 21 | BRAND NEW ME
KBdwzneGHAY.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

RIPU Bhatia feels he has had a second chance at life after surviving meningococcal septicemia. At the age of just 21, Ripu, from Auckland, New Zealand, contracted the blood infection which resulted in the loss of his nose, upper lip and the amputation of his legs and arms. Ripu could not look in the mirror for a long time and lost a lot of confidence. After 250 days in hospitals and a rehab centre, Ripu adapted to these massive physical changes and has gradually rebuilt his confidence. Now, the 27-year-old has fulfilled his dreams of becoming a journalist and feels his experiences serve him well in this role. While he is smashing life career-wise, Ripu wants to get back into exercise, having not been swimming in years since his rehabilitation sessions. Now, he is ready to get back in the pool and this time, with a friend. Ripu told Truly: “To come so close to death and emerge as a physically different person and mentally different, in a lot of ways, is a significant change, to put it lightly. And I do feel I've got a second chance in life.”

Follow Ripu here: https://www.instagram.com/ripubhatia/ 

Videographer: Kirk Pflaum
Producers: Emika Berry, James Thorne
Editor: Akash Beri

bRsEP3yZ8ZY.title: Telling My Blind Date I'm HIV Positive - How Will He React? | LOVE DON'T JUDGE
bRsEP3yZ8ZY.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

HYDEIA Broadbent hit headlines when she was a child as one of the first generation of children in the US born with HIV. She's spent her whole life campaigning for HIV awareness and to destigmatize the condition - but Hydeia's work has impacted her dating life. After coming out of a long term relationship a few years ago Hydeia has struggled with dating, in part due to her HIV status. We follow her on a blind date with investor and podcast host Jake who has an interesting story of his own. As they open up about their stories, will the pair hit it off and want to see each other again?

Hydeia's Socials:
https://www.instagram.com/hydeiabrodbent/
https://www.facebook.com/HydeiaBroadbentFan/

5p-1O95_0ZE.title: I've Spent $100K On My Plastic Surgery Transformation | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
5p-1O95_0ZE.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

ASHLEIGH Candela is the Australian OG of plastic surgery. She's been having procedures over the last 14 years and has spent over $100,000 on her cosmetic surgery obsession. Ashleigh has a taste for the finer things in life; luxury handbags, expensive shoes and of course plastic surgery. Ashleigh told Truly: "I've spent over $100,000 on my plastic surgery, I think about maybe $1,000 a month in treatments, but if I have to get my fillers and things done, it's going to be a lot more." Ashleigh confesses that she's lost count of how many surgeries she's actually had, but hasn't ruled out more in the future. Despite the love she has for herself, Ashleigh says: "There's always gonna be some type of hater like, 'What have you done to your face? What have you done to your lips?' A lot of people can judge but they don't actually know your backstory as to why." Ashleigh's first surgery was to fix damage to her nose. This really helped Ashleigh grow into the person she is today and forged her love of plastic surgery. Ashleigh says she never wants to look old and another nose job is top of her surgery to do list...

Follow Ashleigh here: https://www.instagram.com/the_cosmetic_diary_/

Videographer: Chris Butel
Producers:Adam Fleet, Tom Buckman 
Editor: Giulia Bassanese

-mb2OOaEKXI.title: I Was 287lbs After My Family Died - Look At Me Now | BRAND NEW ME
-mb2OOaEKXI.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

RENATTA Keith, from Huntsville, Alabama, tragically lost her mum, dad and brother all within the space of four years. In order to deal with this chain of heartbreaking events, she turned to food. Renatta told Truly: "I started using food to comfort myself and to cope." She developed a very unhealthy lifestyle, filled with soda, junk food and drive-thru takeaways. At her heaviest Renatta weighed 287lbs. She knew things were spiraling out of control: "When I looked in the mirror, I saw someone who was just really broken and lost." After a spinal surgery, Renatta was given a warning from her doctor that if she didn't start to lose weight, she would need more surgeries in the near future. Renatta wanted to change but didn't enjoy exercise: "I did not do much exercise at all, I hated exercise... Until I met Brandon." With the help and guidance of her trainer Brandon, Renatta lost an incredible 150lbs. She keeps the image of her surgery scar close to remind her of the journey she's been on and to show just how far she's come. Renatta added: "I'm proud of myself and I'm sure my parents are too."

Follow Renatta here:  
https://www.instagram.com/renatta_rising/

Videographer: Michael Darling 
Producers: Adam Fleet, James Thorne
Editor: Hailey Wang

Now you can watch our videos in Spanish!:  http://bit.ly/Suscribirse_truly_ES

3ncN_yejhcs.title: People Say I've Ruined My Face - But I Won't Stop Getting Inked | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
3ncN_yejhcs.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

AMBER Stonelake, from Mountain Home, Arkansas, has been collecting tattoos since she was 20 years old. She has become hooked on getting inked and now has the end goal of having one complete body sleeve. Amber told Truly: "To me everybody looks the same, I really strive to be different. I don't want to look like anybody else in the world." Amber has struggled with self confidence issues, but with each tattoo she gets, the more she feels like her real self. Despite how Amber's look makes her feel, not everybody in the town feels the same way. "Some of the people are like: 'Why did you mess up your face like that? It looks like scribbles on your face' - that's what automatically goes to their brain."  Amber knows that people may have their own opinions, but this won't change her mind about looking exactly the way she wants. "I don't regret any of my tattoos, I love myself and I love who I am." 

Follow Amber here: 
https://www.instagram.com/amber__akashyia/

localized.title: People Say I've Ruined My Face - But I Won't Stop Getting Inked | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
localized.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

AMBER Stonelake, from Mountain Home, Arkansas, has been collecting tattoos since she was 20 years old. She has become hooked on getting inked and now has the end goal of having one complete body sleeve. Amber told Truly: "To me everybody looks the same, I really strive to be different. I don't want to look like anybody else in the world." Amber has struggled with self confidence issues, but with each tattoo she gets, the more she feels like her real self. Despite how Amber's look makes her feel, not everybody in the town feels the same way. "Some of the people are like: 'Why did you mess up your face like that? It looks like scribbles on your face' - that's what automatically goes to their brain."  Amber knows that people may have their own opinions, but this won't change her mind about looking exactly the way she wants. "I don't regret any of my tattoos, I love myself and I love who I am."

_IGoPHVV5xE.title: My Super-Sized Butt Has 1M Fans - And It's Growing! | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
_IGoPHVV5xE.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

A GLAMOUR MODEL has declared her “goal is to have the world’s biggest bum”. Natasha Crown, 28, originally from Serbia, says she first realised she wanted a big bum at age 18. Two years later, age 20, Natasha started her cosmetic journey from what she describes as an athletic teen to a curvy Goddess. Her first procedure on this journey was a Brazilian Butt Lift. Since then, she’s gone on to have three more Brazilian Butt Lifts, one breast augmentation, botox and regularly gets filler. The four Brazilian Butt Lifts that Natasha has had, have added over 100lbs to her bum - but she's not done yet and is eyeing up her fifth bum procedure. So far, Natasha estimates that she’s spent over $100,000 on her cosmetic work, but with no sign of her wanting to put a stop to the procedures, that figure is destined to rise. We meet Natasha today as she looks for a new outfit to show to her online fans. 

Videographer: Matthew Gormly
Producer: Dav Rich, Kim Nguyen 
Editor: Reuben Yarwood

oaCVdqf3AOg.title: 95% Of My Body Is Burnt | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
oaCVdqf3AOg.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

25-YEAR-OLD Jenna Bullen from Oklahoma City sustained burns to over 95% of her body at the young age of three. As her parents were getting ready for a Memorial Day celebration, Jenna was in the garage when a knocked-over gasoline canister ignited a flash fire. With her body covered in 3rd and 4th degree burns, Jenna has had to undergo over 80 surgeries throughout her lifetime. During one of these surgeries in 2015, Jenna’s heart stopped beating whilst on the operating table. Jenna told Truly: “It was very eye-opening for me, I got really depressed and felt like my life was going to be like that forever.” However, the thing that got Jenna back on track, was finding out she was becoming an aunt for the very first time. Jenna said: “My brother told me that he was going to have a baby and something changed, it gave me motivation to get better.” Now Jenna is weeks away from graduating with her Bachelor’s degree in Psychology. To celebrate the special occasion, she wants to do a photoshoot in the traditional “cap and gown”. Having struggled with her confidence growing up, being in front of the camera is something that Jenna doesn’t do often. However, she wants to stress that when you come to terms with who you are, you learn how to love yourself. “Several years ago, I finally realised it’s okay to be different, you don’t want to look like everybody else." 

Follow Jenna here - https://www.instagram.com/iamjennabullen/

Videographer: Chris Sinclair
Producer: Stephanie Stijkel, Ruby Coote  
Editor: Milly Silverthorne

65BdgaKCujA.title: I Lost 107lbs - Now I Know My Worth | BRAND NEW ME
65BdgaKCujA.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

BEFORE she lost weight, Nakeshia felt like she was settling for ‘bottom of the barrel boys’. The 27-year-old from Gary, Indiana had zero self-confidence and would always avoid mirrors. At her heaviest weight of 240lbs in 2017, Nakeshia suffered a ‘skin crawling’ ankle break that made her reassess her lifestyle and begin her weight loss journey. Nakeshia began building her endurance and found a passion for outdoor running and focused on a diet of moderation rather than restriction. In less than four years, Nakeshia lost 107lbs. She has found her confidence and someone who values her and is in a happy relationship with boyfriend Seth. Nakeshia told Truly: “I am so much more confident about my body now; I feel strong, I feel empowered, I feel beautiful. The confidence level that I have now versus where I was, it's in two different stratospheres.”

Follow Nakeshia here: 
https://www.instagram.com/keeshnicoletv/
https://youtube.com/c/KeeshNicoleTV

_uwudKQrJOQ.title: I Waist Train 10 Hours A Day To Get These Curves | MIAMI MUSCLE
_uwudKQrJOQ.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

BECKY STALLION is the social media influencer whose natural assets have earned her an array of brand collaborations and admirers. Growing up in Louisiana but now residing in Dallas, Texas, Becky brings her southern charm to everything she does. Big thighs and hips run in the women of Becky's family, and the nickname 'stallion' has been around for years. Becky told Truly: “Stallion is southern slang for big and fine! I got the name from guys around the way, always telling me "I'm built like one" so it's sorta stuck and here I am today." To help her along the way, Becky lives and breathes in her waist trainer to make sure she gets that extra pop in the hips. The main brand Becky works with is a fashion company - which is a blessing as finding clothes to cater for her body shape is a nightmare. Today, they have sent Becky some new outfits she has to promote and we see her work her magic in front of the camera.  

Thank you to Trevor for his photography. To see more of his work, click here: https://www.instagram.com/hb_toochie/?hl=en

2F4pyaKsR1s.title: I'm A Successful Businesswoman - So Why Am I Judged For My Tatts? | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
2F4pyaKsR1s.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

MONAMI FROST, 27, is 90% covered in tattoos and piercings - but she hasn’t let the stereotypes about body ink get in the way of her dreams. Originally from Latvia, Monami admits she didn’t let other people’s judgements stop her from covering her whole body. She told Truly: “It started off as just getting one tattoo and slowly I wanted more. You get one and you start feeling addicted.” The majority of Monami’s body and face is covered, and she reckons she’s spent around £25,000 on her ink and piercings since starting at age 14. After moving to the UK, Monami, also a mum to two daughters, started to think about her next steps, and set up not one, but two new businesses, and also released her own cookbook. "You wouldn't see the tattooed girl having a recipe book and I thought it would be a good way to kind of beat some sort of stereotype.” Even with her huge success, Monami says people still judge her for her tattoos, particularly when it comes to being a mum. She adds that online, she gets comments ‘on a daily basis’ about parenting with tattoos. Monami admits: “What would I say to people that judge me for my tattoos? Don't judge a book by its cover.” 

Follow Monami here: https://www.instagram.com/monamifrost/

Videographer: Thomas White
Producer: Cecily Snowball, Kim Nguyen
Editor: Sarah-Jayne Galpin

"You wouldn't see the tattooed girl having a recipe book and I thought it would be a good way to kind of beat some sort of stereotype.” Even with her huge success, Monami says people still judge her for her tattoos, particularly when it comes to being a mum. She adds that online, she gets comments ‘on a daily basis’ about parenting with tattoos. Monami admits: “What would I say to people that judge me for my tattoos? Don't judge a book by its cover.” 

Follow Monami here: https://www.instagram.com/monamifrost/

Videographer: Thomas White
Producer: Cecily Snowball, Kim Nguyen
Editor: Sarah-Jayne Galpin

seDsbIGEKmE.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

BECKY Holt has “lost count” of the number of tattoos she’s had, but estimates that her body is now 95% covered in ink. The 33-year-old from Cheshire, UK, has made a name for herself as an alternative model. However, after falling pregnant last year she has moved into working in the world of interior design, wanting a different career path as the direction of her life was changing. In this episode of Transformed, Becky is given a ‘mumsy’ makeover, covering all her tattoos to match her lifestyle shift. Being a tattooed mum has led to Becky receiving judgment about her appearance. She told Truly: "The reaction that I get in the public is mixed. People say that I've ruined myself, that I've made a big mistake.” Becky reveals her new look to her two best friends, but will they prefer her transformation into a typical 'plain Jane'?

sapW46Yffbk.title: My Small Freckle Turned Into A 40KG Tumour | BORN DIFFERENT
sapW46Yffbk.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

KARINA Rodini, 30, from Curitiba, Brazil, is seeking life-changing surgery to deal with a colossal 40kg tumour on her left leg and hip. Karina has neurofibromatosis type 1 (NF1), a condition that causes tumours to grow along the nerves. Karina had small brown patches on her skin from the age of eight or nine, but at age 14 her more substantial “plexiform” tumours began to grow - starting as a freckle and expanding until the one covering her leg and hip reached its present size. Karina’s condition means she has to get a seamstress to custom-make her clothes and can only walk short distances. Karina has already had 10 surgeries but her sister Patricia has now found a surgeon willing to remove her largest tumour - but Karina now has to raise the funds needed for the operation, which will leave her hospitalised for six months after the surgery. 

Donate to Karina’s fundraising campaign at: 
https://www.gofundme.com/f/karina-rodini-neurofibromatosis-surgery?utm_source=customer&utm_medium=copy_link&utm_campaign=p_cp_guide_do&member=9103438

Follow Karina at:
https://www.instagram.com/superandoaneurofibromatose/
https://www.facebook.com/superandoaneurofibromatose/

Videographer: Luciano Coelho
Producers: Camile Rocha-Keys, Charles Richards
Editor: Cecilia Brunell
Photographer: Diogo Schechtelv

mRoerVx8C5Q.title: My £200k Transition Is Complete - But Will I Get The All-Clear? | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
mRoerVx8C5Q.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

JESSICA ALVES, formally known as Roddy Alves, is at the beginning of a brand new life now that her gender reassignment surgery in Bangkok, Thailand, at Kamol Hospital is complete. Jessica spent £200,000 and has been transitioning over the past 18 months. She decided to transition so she could be happy in her life and become not just more confident, but the person she has always wanted to be. Jessica told Truly: “I have been waiting for this moment to actually be happy. I've been waiting all my life to have this surgery. I'm excited to feel this new feeling throughout my body. At the age of 37, I am a virgin and restarting my life from scratch. That’s how it feels. I am starting my life all over again." Jessica chose Dr. Kamol for this life changing procedure. “Dr. Kamol did his best, and not to achieve the best result aesthetically, but also, internally."

Follow Jessica' journey here: 
https://www.instagram.com/jessicaalvesuk/
https://www.kamolhospital.com/en/

Videographer: Robert Killorn
Producer: Dav Rich, Charles Richards
Editor: Tom Buckman

GwrcpzIGD70.title: We've Spent $2M On Our Bodies | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
GwrcpzIGD70.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

JUSTIN “HUMAN KEN DOLL'' JEDLICA, has spent $1,000,000 on his body modifications and has just reached his 1,000th procedure. Having hit this huge milestone, Justin has got thinking - is he alone in his quest for extreme body perfection? Justin told Truly: “Being a plastic surgery expert connotes the fact that I've been there, I've done that. I think I'd like to see what the competition looks like on the other side!” As a pioneer and innovator in the plastic surgery field, it was no surprise people would reach out to Justin asking for advice. “It’s really rewarding for me. I've helped hundreds of people with my consulting, but additionally to that I offer services where I actually design custom implants for people." Today, Justin will meet the $1,000,000 Barbie herself, Nikki Exotika, to share the latest gossip and insider beauty secrets. Nikki will also be revealing her latest cosmetic surgery idea to Justin to get his expert advice...

Follow Justin here: https://www.instagram.com/justinjedlica/ 
Follow Nikki here: https://www.instagram.com/nikkiexotika/

7HekMw0sY7E.title: I've Lost 100lbs - And Become A Bodybuilder | BRAND NEW ME
7HekMw0sY7E.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

ANNE-MARIE, from Glasgow, Scotland, was a self confessed party girl. She would go on excessive nights out filled with overindulgence. These would  always be followed by hangovers and terrible eating habits. Anne-Marie told Truly: "Eating that kind of diet, I felt lethargic, tired and couldn't be bothered to do anything. I just wanted to sleep and it made me feel horrific." At her heaviest, Anne-Marie reached 260lbs. "I got to the point where I was just fed up being stuck in a body I hated, I began to go to the gym and started my journey." In just under two years Anne-Marie lost an incredible 100lbs and found a brand new passion...bodybuilding. Anne-Marie started competing in competitions which also brought her love, as she met her partner Darren who was sitting in the audience of her very first bodybuilding show. Anne-Marie, equipped with new confidence and strength, is now aiming to become a professional bodybuilder and achieve a 1st place finish. 

Video Credits:
Videographer / director: Rory Dunning
Producer: Adam Fleet, James Thorne
Editor: Pete Ansell

A FEMALE powerlifter from Los Angeles says that the sport saved her life after growing up with a history of eating disorders. 27-year-old Ru Komiyama, known online as the “Little Beast”, can squat 305lbs and deadlift 363lbs despite being just 5ft tall. In this episode of Truly’s Miami Muscle series, she will attempt to crush a watermelon between her thighs - but will she be able to do it?

DIKXHrbMBFk.description:

A PLUS-SIZED model 'looks like Kim Kardashian' - and she loves the attention she gets because of it. Sammy Krieger, from Portland, Oregon is often told that she looks like Kim K. Sammy says her “tiny waist and big butt, is probably the number one comparison” that she gets. Making the most out of her likeness to Kim K, Sammy has started to recreate iconic Kim K photos and looks. On one occasion Sammy recreated a famous photo of Kim K that went viral on Twitter and even resulted in Kim Kardashian retweeting it, with the message “OMG this is amazing!!” Today, we meet Sammy and follow her to a photoshoot where she’ll once again recreate a famous Kim Kardashian photo.

6zSL14DN5m8.title: My Prom Date Called Me 'Fat' - So I Got Ripped | BRAND NEW ME
6zSL14DN5m8.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

27-YEAR-OLD Anthony Bayer from Queensland, Australia has lost a spectacular 115lbs after being rushed to the hospital. Anthony says his weight issues started in high school, using food as a coping mechanism and consuming over 1,000 calories a day. “Every time I was stressed out I would eat. I would consume three pizzas, three bottles of coke and three packs of Magnum ice cream in one sitting,” he told Truly. Weighing in at 330lbs at his heaviest, Anthony would spend his days at home playing video games. He said: “I had absolutely no confidence, I thought I was going to be alone for the rest of my life." And his fears of ending up alone really intensified when he was stood up for his high school prom. “I asked the most attractive girl in school to be my date and she said yes. I knocked on her door on the day of the formal and she started laughing, at that moment I realised I was set up.” A few months later, Anthony woke up in the middle of the night suffering from heart palpitations. Rushed to the hospital, the doctor explained to him that his irregular heartbeat was down to the pressure put on his body by the excess weight. On the verge of type 2 diabetes, Anthony was urged to make a drastic change to his diet. Researching healthy diets, going for walks and eventually joining a gym, Anthony managed to lose 115lbs in total. He added: “My transformation changed me mentally, now I’m confident, willing to go out there and live my life to the fullest." 

Follow Anthony Here - 
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCyyqQLUL2CtoD1nX6IvvYWg
https://www.instagram.com/goodmananthony/?hl=en

Producer: Stephanie Stijkel

TGgZvExFuQY.title: I Waited 10 Years For My Prisoner Husband - Then He Got Deported | LOVE DON’T JUDGE
TGgZvExFuQY.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

Having met her husband two years into a 13-year prison sentence for attempted murder, Carla, 30, and Erik Aguirre, 31, from California, were understandably excited to be reunited on the outside - having spent only around 50 days of their decade-long relationship together. But their joy was short-lived as on the day of his release Erik was sent to an immigration detention centre, before being deported back to his native Mexico - a country he hadn’t lived in since the age of 10. The couple now live together in Tijuana, Mexico and say that while the switch from 15-minute daily phone calls to 24:7 cohabitation took some adjusting to, they are now happily settled and planning a family together. Erik says that Carla’s love changed his outlook on life and the pair now share their lives on their YouTube channel, which Carla set up while Erik was incarcerated to help other people with family members or partners in jail. 

For more follow:
Carla on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/its_carla_biatch/
Erik on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/_94bg_/
Carla and Erik's YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCd3rqFzWDic7HiojDG40qlw

Videographer: Jacki Huntington
Producers: Ruby Cooke and Tom Midlane
Editor: Thom Johnson

2GG_9aeqYUc.title: My 52" Legs Earn Me $4000 A Month | SHAKE MY BEAUTY
2GG_9aeqYUc.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

AT 6ft 8 (and a half) inches tall, Savvy always stands out from the crowd  and that’s just fine with her. The 26-year-old used to be self-conscious about her height but has now turned it to her advantage, making around $3,000 to $4,000 a month for niche modelling jobs. The model comes from an incredibly tall family (her dad is 6ft 8", mum is 6ft 3", while her 21-year-old brother is 7ft 4" and her younger sister (24) is 6ft 6") and from a young age Savvy and her siblings were encouraged to celebrate their tall stature rather than hide from it. But as a teenager, Savvy struggled with her appearance. By sixth grade she was 6ft 2", wearing size 12 shoes and struggling to find clothes to wear like the rest of her peers. Savvy kept growing and was 6ft 7" by eight grade, reaching her final height of 6ft 8.5" by age 18. After having to medically retire from her planned basketball career, Savvy has found herself and her 52.5 inch legs embarking on a new career as a model.

Follow Savvy here - 
https://www.instagram.com/p/CH0kZIgJhXe/ 
https://www.tiktok.com/@savvy_trapp/video/6865373130366455045 

Videographer / Director: Marius Anderson 
Producer: Nathalie Bonney
Editor: Cecilia Brunelli, Ruby Coote

Kz2NFvup8-s.title: I Lost 280lbs - And It Saved My Life | BRAND NEW ME
Kz2NFvup8-s.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

MOM of three April Wood, from Arizona, has lost an incredible 280lbs through diet and exercise. Growing up, April says she always struggled with being overweight, she told Truly: “Around the age of 12 is when I started to go into the ‘obese’ catagory, I started high school probably weighing around 200-250lbs and by the time I was done, I weighed 350lbs.” At her heaviest weighing in at 440lbs, April struggled with constant fatigue preventing her from being able to play with her kids. Her wake up call happened whilst watching a video of her daughter learning how to walk. “My daughter Chloe was just learning how to walk and I wanted to stand up and go to her, but I weighed so much that it was too hard to get up from the couch. That was the catalyst moment." Determined to make a change, April started working out and eating healthily, quickly shedding pound after pound. And things really took a turn when she met her personal trainer and gym owner Matt Hoodie: “Matt has been instrumental in me getting to my weight loss goal, he’s lost 130lbs himself so he understands the mental and physical challenges.” However, losing all the excess weight had a downside; April was left with lots of loose skin. She added: “I worked so hard for the body that I wanted, but the excess skin was there, like a scar of the battle I had fought." April has since had two skin removal surgeries and breast implants, finally finishing off her weight loss journey. Although April says maintaining her goal weight is almost harder than losing the excess weight, she’s adamant to keep pushing. 

Follow April here - 
https://www.instagram.com/phoenix_girl_rising/

Video Credits:
Videographer / director: 
Producer: Stephanie Stijkel, Kim Nguyen
Editor: Milly Silverthorne

ba3UqfKN1b4.title: I Want The World's Biggest Natural Butt | HOOKED ON THE LOOK
ba3UqfKN1b4.description:
SUBSCRIBE to Truly: http://bit.ly/Oc61Hj

VANESSA Ataides, 35, from Brasília, Brazil is attempting to reach the huge milestone of having the biggest bum in the world through diet and exercise. She wakes up at 4am each day to start working out, with her routines tailored towards her bum, and she maintains her energy with six meals a day. Vanessa told Truly: “I’m a person who likes a lot of attention so when I started working out and seeing the result, getting bigger and bigger, I wanted it more and more." Vanessa’s bum is currently measured around 126cm, but her next goal is 130cm. When asked by friends, family and social media followers why she wants to reach this goal, she admits: “To have the biggest bum makes me happy, satisfied, and beautiful. I’m very addicted to having a bigger bum.” Vanessa regularly measures her bum to check her progress...but is she growing at the rate she wants? 

Videographer: Pedro Ladeira Tavares
Producers: Cecily Snowball, Ruby Coote
Editor: Pete Ansell
Fixer: Marilia Marasciulo
